Job_Descriptions: Technology Singapore, Singapore Description Overview of the Job Xaxis is an agency of GroupM, the world’s largest media investment company and are a part of WPP. In fact, we are responsible for one in every three ads you see globally. As a Xaxis Engagement Manager, you will be responsible for evangelizing Xaxis solutions amongst your peers within agencies. You will be responsible for developing deep relationships with WPP agencies to ensure optimal adoption of all product features. You will collaborate with a group of quick-witted co-workers and clients who are all passionate about digital media. You will engage with our clients in professional and social settings, build relationships and define and implement products, which make us indispensable to our clients. This is a high profile position with a wealth of opportunity for growth professionally and personally. Reporting of the role This role reports to the Client Development Director 3 best things about the job: It’s a great work environment - You will collaborate with a group of quick witted, humorous, diverse and extremely dedicated colleagues who are all passionate about programmatic and making advertising welcome Opinions and ideas are highly encouraged, and everyone has a voice at Xaxis. Ambition is expected and passion is admired. We are always open to new ways of thinking from everyone, especially those that will contribute to the overall success of Xaxis. It is never static. You are empowered to create your own balance and be proactive. There is always something new to learn, new challenges to overcome, and new technology to embrace everyday. Measures of success – In three months: Have an in depth understanding of how Xaxis operates and where we fit into the programmatic landscape Develop relationships and earn trust across your client and agency portfolio as well as within your own team In six months: Demonstrated success in management of your accounts and campaigns In 12 months: Be able to put together and showcase future strategic planning for your agency & account Responsibilities of the role: Manage agency/client relationships Be the Xaxis product expert for your agencies, evangelizing Xaxis’ world class digital solutions Develop strong and effective media plans based on sound strategies Supervise sales administration process and ensure adherence to best practice Work with the Campaign Management team to ensure best practice campaign optimization and campaign reporting Work with creative agencies and ad operations teams to ensure effective ad development and campaign setup What you will need: Minimum 2 years of experience in digital media planning and/or ad network account management Demonstrated success in managing large client campaigns Ability to build strong partnerships and negotiate effectively Excellent with numbers and a strong eye for detail Strategic thinker and problem solver Organized, proactive, with the ability to develop innovative solutions Experience with ad serving technology Advanced computer knowledge (Excel, PowerPoint) About Xaxis Xaxis is a global digital media platform that programmatically connects advertisers to audiences across all addressable channels. Through the expert use of proprietary data and advertising technology along with unparalleled media relationships, Xaxis delivers results for over 2,800 clients in 40 markets across North America, Europe, Asia Pacific, Latin America and the Middle East. Advertisers working with Xaxis achieve exceptionally high return on advertising spend through the company’s proprietary media products, as well as through its wholly-owned specialist companies, Light Reaction, Bannerconnect, and ActionX.  For more information, visit . About Singapore GroupM Singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. Although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry which is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. Being at the crossroads of Asia means, that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients, renowned brands and media owners. Making GroupM Singapore the Number One organisation to join and develop your career in media investment. GroupM is an equal opportunity employer. We view everyone as an individual and we understand that inclusion is more than just diversity – it’s about belonging. We celebrate the fact that everyone is unique and that’s what makes us so good at what we do. We pride ourselves on being a company that embraces difference and truly represents the global clients we work with.

Local Unit & Position Description Maritime Communications supports Maritime at DNV, the world's leading classification society, in driving the industry transition towards a digital, efficient and eco-friendly future; through broadening our reputation as a thought leader and accelerating revenue generation. The team comprises over 20 committed and high-performing international communications and marketing experts in 7 countries responsible for strategy and leadership communications, marketing communications, branding, digital communications, media relations & PR, social media as well as employee communications. The Digital Communications & Sales Enablement team takes ownership of all DNV Maritime’s digital communication channels and leads the planning, alignment, implementation and execution of digital communication campaigns. In addition, the team has a clear objective to aim their communication efforts at valuable digital lead generation. To achieve this, the team defines and optimizes the end-to-end lead process in close cooperation with our global sales and business development organization. We are looking for an ambitious, digitally savvy and daring intern to join us in lifting our global digital communication activities to the next level. The position will be based in Singapore with a strong focus to support on strategic ambitions in the Asian markets, social media, online customer journey and will report to the Global Digital Communications Manager. Responsibilities: Support the Global Digital Communications Manager and Asia Hub with executingintegrated, multi-channel digital campaigns with smart segmentations to public and customer audiences to achieve set objectives and grow sales Support our regional digital communications activities and strategic growth ambitions in the Asian market, whilst ensuring to elevating regional best-practices to global scale Support our social marketing activities Support CMS migration And other related ad hoc activities Position Qualifications Digital mindset with a high motivation and affinity to work with a state-of-the-art marketing technology Daring to constantly test and pilot new approaches while not being afraid to fail and learn Excellent team-player, open to collaborate and share with the ability to also getting things done independently Strong communicator with a can-do attitude, organizational sensitivity and ability to advice and convince key stakeholders in a professional manner Detail-oriented and not afraid of administrative tasks Ability to work in a fast-paced environment University degree in Marketing, Communications or similar High proficiency in English (written and spoken) Global mindset with a profound background and experiences in Asia Proficiency in Asian languages a bonus Company & Business Area Description DNV is the independent expert in risk management and assurance, with almost 12,000 employees operating in more than 100 countries. Through our broad experience and deep expertise we advance safety and sustainable performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions. We are the world’s leading classification society and a recognized advisor for the maritime industry. We enhance safety, quality, energy efficiency and environmental performance of the global shipping industry – across all vessel types and offshore structures. We invest heavily in research and development to find solutions, together with the industry, that address strategic, operational or regulatory challenges. Equal Opportunity Statement DNV is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this diversity! Recommended Skills Administration Attention To Detail Business Development Content Management English Lead Generation

Element has an opportunity for a Administrator to join our growing team. This is a great opportunity to develop your Administration career within a Global TIC business. This position will be based in Tuas Ave 2. Responsibilities Assist with the Reception desk as required and other associated tasks, including directing incoming calls and visitor arrival/departure and conduct customer safety inductions as well responsible for organising couriers, overseas deliveries and mails Using the in-house database and other systems effectively to ensure maximum efficiency Ability to work flexibly in a busy environment with an established team and processes Maintain filing system and preparation of customer invoices and management of invoicing process and able to enhance, improvise and execute the adminstration process Management of customer test/technical report preparation and issues and all administrative staff including sample collection driver and test report administrator. Management of end-to-end procurement process for all laboratory requirements, and management of consumable stock levels To be a Brand Ambassador for the organization Skills / Qualifications Possess a minimum Diploma in Science or Engineering major Relevant experience within an office environment would be advantageous Candidate is proficient in MS Office Applications Highly motivated and organized individual with a flexible approach to work Excellent attention to detail and ability to work independently #LI-PN1 Diversity Statement At Element, we always take pride in putting our people first. We are an equal opportunity employer that recognizes diversity and inclusion as fundamental to our Vision of becoming “the world’s most trusted testing partner”. All suitably qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective work related criteria and without regard for the following: race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, and/or protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the applicable governing laws. Our bodies and environment all depend on water, it is the building block that supports all life. Water issues are becoming increasingly prominent as we struggle with the disparity between water availability and demands, water pollution, and competition for limited water resources. At Jacobs, we recognize these challenges, and our engineers, scientists, and planners are working together with clients to find the right solutions to their water challenges. Our Water business would like to hire another Resident Engineer to be part of a strategic Water Pipeline project located at Jurong Island as a Resident Engineer. Carry out duties and responsibilities in accordance to the Building Control Act as full-time Qualified Site Supervisor (RE) on record for the supervision of the works on site Work with the Superintending Officer and representatives and be responsible for enforcing specification and code Proactively provide periodic site progress updates to the client PUB Experience in pipe laying and pipe jacking works (large diameter). Experience in working inside Jurong Island will be an added advantage. Review Contractor submissions and assess progress claims with QS. Manage and work closely with RTOs, WSHOs, PRO, QS and Certified Welding Inspectors (CWI) assigned to the project Keep and maintain proper site records and documentation To be a successful candidate you shall possess: Degree in Civil Engineering with minimum 5 years of relevant experience in site supervision of civil engineering works preferably in pipe jacking and pipe laying works. Possessed certificate from Institution of Engineers Singapore (IES) as Accredited RE Other information: Working location at Jurong Island (transport provided) Forty-four working hours (5.5 days) 30 months long term contract renewable Jacobs. A world where you can. From our inclusive employee networks, to our positive mental health champions – we’re committed to driving a culture of caring where you can be you. Joining Jacobs not only connects you locally but globally - and together, our diverse perspectives and unique backgrounds power our collective strength. We collaborate and share! By supporting one another, we all succeed. With safety and flexibility always top of mind, we’ve gone beyond traditional ways of working so you have the support, means and space to maximise your potential. You’ll uncover flexible working arrangements, benefits and opportunities to do good too – from participating in our global giving and volunteering program, to exploring new and inventive ways to help our clients make the world a better place. No matter what drives you, you’ll discover how you can cultivate, nurture and achieve your goals – all at a single global company. Job_Title: Supply Chain Business Process Analyst (Technical Architect)
Job_Descriptions: We are looking for the right people — people who want to innovate, achieve, grow and lead. We attract and retain the best talent by investing in our employees and empowering them to develop themselves and their careers. Experience the challenges, rewards and opportunity of working for one of the world’s largest providers of products and services to the global energy industry. The Supply Analyst (Technology Architect) will define the software and hardware infrastructure to efficiently integrate systems within  the Halliburton Manufacturing Supply Chain Organization.  These solutions are critical to the initiative supporting the implementation of Industry 4.0 technologies.   The scope of work will encompass integrations with both internally developed systems as well as third party software offerings. These integrations will support end user collaboration tool sets,  business application solutions for the shop floor and back office, a common Business Intelligence platform delivering decision quality information, and the modeling of data structures and data flows between systems.   The Architect will collaborate with business analysts, end users, software developers, and data base administrators. Required Skill set: Defining technology stack for new initiatives Demonstrated Proficiency in Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio SQL and TSQL language Strong data modeling skills representing 3rd order normalization SQL stored procedure development Database Migrations Proficiency in Visual Studio IDE Software development skills in Microsoft Blazor environment required Languages – C#, VB, Java Demonstrated expertise designing and implementing unstructured data solutions within the Enterprise Proficiency with API integration and management platforms (i.e. Mulesoft) Knowledge in Microsoft Azure Environment and Storage Architecture Knowledge in Supply Chain Applications platforms – SAP, Warehouse Management system, Procurement, etc. Prefer experience with Industry 4.0 – IOT, Sensors, PLC deployment within Operational Technology networks Halliburton is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, citizenship, marital status, sex/gender, sexual preference/ orientation, gender identity, age, veteran status, national origin, or any other status protected by law or regulation . Location 11 Tuas South Avenue 12, Singapore, Singapore, 637131, Singapore Job Details Requisition Number: 130183 Experience Level: Experienced Hire Job Family: Support Services Product Service Line: Supply Chain Mgmt Full Time / Part Time: Full Time Additional Locations for this position: Compensation Information Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience. Recommended Skills Api Business Intelligence Business Software C Sharp (Programming Language) Data Modeling Data Structures

Our bodies and environment all depend on water, it is the building block that supports all life. Water issues are becoming increasingly prominent as we struggle with disparity between water availability and demands, water pollution, and competition for limited water resources. At Jacobs, we recognize these challenges and our engineers, scientists, and planners are working together with clients to find the right solutions to their water challenges. Our Water team would like to welcome an Assistant Resident Engineer (ARE) to be initially based in the Tuas Water Reclamation Plant project, where subsequently will take greater responsibilities in the future. The ARE Civil works under the LRE Civil and oversees civil, structural, and architectural (CSA) works for the construction of the assigned facility within TWRP.  They will work across all TWRP contracts assigned to the facility, to monitor, support and guide the implementation of all CSA works by the Contractors including both Contractor designed elements as well as the procurement, installation, testing of the CSA works.  They will with the Resident Technical Officers (RTO) within the Construction Manager led teams responsible for specific TWRP contracts within the facility to maintain consistency across all the contracts in that facility and ensure that all works are in compliance with the specifications and applicable codes and regulations.  The ARE Civil will be part of a larger team of REs and RTOs with an indirect reporting line to the Lead RE Civil for the facility and Chief Resident Engineer working across all TWRP contracts. The ARE will work closely with the Resident Engineers, Chief Resident Engineer, Engineering Manager in Jacobs, the Client PUB and with 3rd Parties and be able to effectively communicate and coordinate with all the parties.  The ARE will work closely with all other resident engineering teams, especially the resident Mechanical, ICA, and process teams on all coordination matters Essential Duties: Under general supervision of a Project / Construction Manager, Lead RE and Chief Resident Engineer, evaluates, selects, and applies standard engineering and construction management and supervision techniques, procedures, and criteria. Under general supervision of a Project Manager /Construction Manager, and Lead RE, carry out general contract administration and management Work closely with the Resident Technical Officer(s) (RTO) assigned to the project. With additional experience within one area, the individual is expected to assist in the design of larger and more complex assignments Provides leadership and accountability for the implementation, and measurable performance, of the Jacobs Beyond Health and Safety Program. To be a successful candidate, you shall possess: Bachelor in Engineering (Civil / Structural) – from an approved university (under BCA’s list of the accepted universities for RE registration), with the ability to get accredited as a Resident Engineer Min 1 year of relevant construction experience. This is an exciting time for our team at Jacobs. We’re at the intersection of technology, engineering and design helping our clients tackle the biggest challenges facing our cities and communities across the globe. “From large scale regeneration and climate change response, to multi-purpose and smart infrastructure, we are delivering integrated and resilient solutions that reinvent the future, reconnect communities and create lasting value.” Monte Wilson - Global Built Environment Market Director These big issues inspire us to go further to understand how multifaceted variables shape our future, ensuring that the solutions we design and deliver connect people and places with the means to work smarter and live better while making a positive, enduring difference in the world. Our Life Science business in the Singapore office is currently seeking an HSE Lead. This role will mainly be responsible for helping Life Science businesses deal with any HSE matters across projects and clients. Key responsibilities: Ensures all new employees are assigned the correct worker category and have undertaken the required HSE training such as Global & Local HSE induction, ADT, Ergonomic, and other HSE training. Where required, ensure that these training are supplemented with local content as needed Coordinate/run and be a focal point for HSE forums in Singapore such as Beyond Zero Committee, Project HSE committees and ensure that these forums are a proactive platform for HSE innovations Under general direction, indirectly manage & coach Singapore staff at various levels of operations. Regional Finance Director Earthstream has partnered with a world mineral and mining business with assets across Africa with a large pipeline of projects being prospected and developed. As such, Earthstream is looking to recruit a Regional Financial Director which is an integral role with high visibility to the business. Working closely with accounting, corporate finance, development, international operations, and external advisors. In this role, you are a key contributor to the preparation, review, and reporting of internal and external finance activities. What You'll Do Management of the Group finance function including, but not limited to, financial control, accounting, treasury, reporting, tax and audit functions. Prepare and support the development of budgets, financial forecasts, and variance analysis, in consultation with the Finance, Operation and project management team. Preparation of financial analysis, reporting packs and presentation to key stakeholders and potential investors Assist in performing the due diligence, research, and analysis on any potential merger & acquisitions, liaise with direct transaction team and coordinate transaction execution and closing. Supporting in key corporate finance and strategic initiatives, such as leading the implementation of potential Merger & Acquisition and any future financings with a view to optimize the capital structure of the Group Involved in corporate development and overseas M&A projects (relating to legal, financial, tax and technical due diligence) Perform financial analysis & financial modelling with key financial summary and recommendation on the Group portfolio of assets. Knowledge and ability to perform various type of financial models to value debt and equity for merger & acquisitions and potential capital raising transactions via various valuation methods - comparable companies, precedents and DCF. Involved in the preparation of cash flow & business valuation modelling for acquisition and project financing. Support, prepare and publish monthly and quarterly financial and investment reports. Investment portfolio to be prepared in a professional manner and presented to the key stakeholders on a regular basis (Chairman, CEO and potential investors). Actively engage with the Operation and Project Management teams on the project financial performance (project spending, CAPEX, OPEX) on a weekly/ monthly basis. Results to be prepared and reported to the senior management team. Standardize accounting policies and establish processes across the Group (East Africa, Mauritius, Singapore, Hong Kong, Monaco). Ensure compliance to both internal and external audit requirements Review of accounting manual and policies for internal control purposes, and provide recommendation and improvement points Actively collaborate and support the Business Performance Management on any new business opportunities from the financial and commercial perspective. Develop and document business processes and FinCom policies to maintain and strengthen internal controls. What we require? Degree in accountancy, finance, business administration or related discipline. ACCA/ CPA certified. Minimum 10 years of experience in accounting/ tax/ corporate finance function in the commercial sector. Strong experience in supporting M&A due diligence; financial/ business valuation modelling will be essential. Candidates from Oil & Gas/ Project/ Mining industries will be an added advantage. The potential candidate should have the following attributes: Ability to adapt quickly based on the business requirements and work well under pressure within the tight timeline. Excellent communication skills. Tech Stream Group International is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy. Recommended Skills Adaptability Association Of Chartered Certified Accountants Auditing Business Administration Business Development Business Performance Management

Schneider Electric has an opportunity for a Global Sustainable Supply Chain Manager . Are you a person who is passionate about Supply Chain sustainability, circular economy, and climate change? Are you interested in working for the most sustainable company in the world, recognized by Corporate Knights? If you are driven to make changes for sustainability and want to work with an inspiring team, we want to talk to you! Schneider Electric’s mission is to be a digital partner for Sustainability and Efficiency. We drive digital transformation by integrating world-leading process and energy technologies, end-point to cloud connecting products, controls, software, and services, across the entire lifecycle, enabling integrated company management, for homes, buildings, data centers, infrastructure, and industries. We are the most local of global companies. We are advocates of open standards and partnership ecosystems that are passionate about our shared Meaningful Purpose, Inclusive, and Empowered values. RESPONSIBILITIES: Implement and deploy the Global Supply Chain (GSC) sustainability strategy and programs in collaboration with Regional teams and other Business Units Contribute to refine and reformulate the global program of supply chain sustainability around circular economy, net zero carbon emission, green packaging & materials and biodiversity Help to create the supplier environmental Impact, including responsible sourcing and procurement, management of Manufacturing Quality and Logistics sustainability Monitor the key performance indicators and drive high performance Benchmark external best practices in the supply chain sustainability Collaborate with other functions in the context of EHS & Sustainability such as: GSC overall, for decision-making support with EHS & CO2 lens Procurement: support the design and roll-out of EHS & Sustainability procedures embedding EHS & Sustainability in operational processes (e.g. supplier selection, EHS/Sustainability risk analysis, green materials, green packaging, etc.) Finance: Environmental liabilities oversight (processes and governance roll-out, coordination with GSC finance functions, etc.) Coordination with Insurance, Internal Audit, Legal affairs, Security, to define practical ways to team up and embed directives and expectations into these functions’ own frameworks and processes. SUCCESS CRITERIA: Creating positive collaborations and relationship with other stakeholders in the corporate team, and bringing teams together from across the organization Being recognized as a supply chain sustainability expert internally and externally Demonstrating strong convincing and communication skill Exemplifying learning agility and digital mind-set Handling sensitive and confidential information Process transformation, internal audit, program & change management experiences are preferred A great dose of Passion for Sustainability, self-starting attitude, and ability to bring new would be great assets for the role INTERACTIONS: Mostly Global Supply Chain (Global, Regions, BU correspondents): Manufacturing, Logistics, Procurement Group Functions: Sustainability, Finance, Internal Audit, Legal, Security, Internal Communications, HR, IT / Digital Schneider, Customer Satisfaction & Quality, etc. Business Units Operations (countries & sales) Recommended Skills Agility Auditing Change Management Communication Confidentiality Customer Satisfaction

SUMMARY: The Regional Compliance Program Director (“PMO”) is a core member of the MD Regional Leadership team & the MD Global Compliance Program Management, reporting directly to the MD HCC ASPAC Regional Sector Lead. The PMO is responsible for implementing and executing various sector specific projects, consistent with the compliance program and business needs and standards in ASPAC, delivering business process improvement in the region, improving efficiency and effectiveness of the HCC programs, whilst supporting successful change management implementation. The PMO will be engaged in identifying new focus areas and contributing to the implementation of the global PMO strategy in ASPAC, working closely with Global and regional PMOs, as well as country HCCOs and function HCC teams, to mitigate compliance risk and align with priority business areas. PROFILE: High level of integrity with good ethical core values Requires deep knowledge of HCC programs and anti-corruption laws and regulations. A creative thinker, able to understand and describe complex business processes, highly solution oriented, with a hands-on mentality, able to balance between local and global requirements, operating with a global, cross-sector mindset. Effective listener and communicator, being able to understand unique requirements, while fostering harmonization and alignment. Excellent English verbal and written communication skills, including formal presentation skills. Experience in leading projects in one or more compliance areas e.g., HCC, FCPA, Finance, Quality, Regulatory. Ability to successfully manage multiple, critical projects simultaneously. Ability to influence, negotiate and communicate with both internal and external stakeholders. Highly self-motivated, strong agility and resilience. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Collaboration with country HCC officers, across the clusters in MD ASPAC, to scope, design, initiate and implement PMO projects. Leads and executes PMO ASPAC projects for the Operating Companies (“OpCo”).  Assists the MD Regional Sector Lead with the development of an effective project portfolio management structure, promoting necessary changes, process harmonization and leveraging experiences and approaches to/from other regions. In partnership with the Compliance Program Management at a Global Level, co-ordinates with IT partners to capture OpCo user requirements, identifies gaps, defines required change actions and communicates findings and recommendations to key stakeholders, including HCC local teams and Regional Sector Leads. Shares best practice within HCC to develop and implement consistent controls across the region, where necessary. Supports the development of harmonized standard processes applicable for all countries in ASPAC, where necessary. Represents ASPAC PMO on project teams to harmonize, standardize and streamline HCC processes and systems. Seeks opportunities for new solutions through innovative approaches, identified through internal and external network. Other duties may be assigned by Regional Sector Lead. Qualifications EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE: Bachelor’s degree required; advanced degree is preferred Minimum of 15 years of experience in the pharmaceutical and/or medical device industries; Supervisory experience preferred Cross-functional and/or cross-sector experience preferred HCCO experience as an advantage Experience leading in a multi-national environment Experience in process improvement methodologies and process mapping preferred Green Belt certification and Project Management Skills is a plus Knowledge of the FCPA and related anti-corruption regulations COMMENTS:  This position description is an outline of the major recurring responsibilities of the job.  It is not intended to be all-inclusive of the work to be performed.  Other related job objectives, special assignments and less significant responsibilities will typically be performed by the incumbent(s). Primary Location Singapore-Singapore-Singapore- Organization Johnson & Johnson Pte. Ltd. (8435) Job Function Legal Requisition ID 2206005772W

Site Name: Singapore - Tuas Posted Date: Feb 4 2022 Professional Conversion Program (PCP) is an initiative jointly supported by Workforce Singapore (WSG) and Temasek Polytechnic (TP) and is aimed at building a pipeline of skilled manpower for Singapore’s biopharmaceutical manufacturing industry in anticipation of hiring demand. The training programme is consists of a 3-months structured facilitated training conducted by TP, followed by 15 months of local attachment with GSK.  Due to the nature of the programme, we can only consider Singapore Citizens and Singapore Permanent Residents. For more information, please visit A certificate will be given to successful trainees upon completion of the programme. Materials Planner You will provide support to ensure reliable and timely supply of materials in accordance with the business and compliance requirements of GSK Vaccines, including: developing material requirement/replenishment schedule, helping to streamline, provide accountability and ownership for life cycle management, change control and deviations pertaining to QA controlled incoming materials. You will have the opportunity to be exposed to the following: Manage material requirement planning - analyse and understand the users’ material consumption needs, liaise with vendors on order management and ensure timely delivery of materials, tracking and managing vendor performance and managing invoicing issues due to quantity discrepancies. Evaluate and provide disposition for incoming toll materials. Accurate and timely update of material provisioning master data. Change control and deviation management - Initiate, manage and own change controls, deviations and CAPA associated for new and existing QA controlled incoming materials in a timely manner. Be the Process Owner for new incoming materials introduction and co-ordinate with local stakeholders and global counterparts to ensure timely and accurate implementation of new incoming material on site. Support regulatory audits. Project management. What qualifications do I need to apply? We look for people who appreciate the importance of safety and quality and strive to continuously improve our performance and practices.  We work in an open and transparent environment so you’ll be someone who treats others with respect and integrity – as you will be treated yourself. Ideally we are looking for candidates with: Degree in Business/Supply Chain or science discipline with strong interest in supply chain management. Good knowledge of MS office. Knowledge of relevant SAP modules would be an added advantage. Excellent presentation, communication, planning and co-coordinating skills Meticulous, proactive and team player Other requirements: Singaporean (core priority) or Singapore PR only – for Program and Grant requirement For male applicants: completed National Service within 60 months prior to course start. Where will I be based? You will be based at one of our manufacturing sites in Singapore near Tuas. When can I start? PCP Program starts in May 2022 (tentatively), while the On the Job training start in Aug 2022. How can I apply? Applications are now open. Click on the button above to apply. Applications close 15 Mar 2022 (We recommend you apply as soon as possible, because we accept ongoing applications and offer positions on a first come, first served basis!) At GSK we value diversity and treat all candidates equally. We strive to make our recruitment process free of bias of any kind and aim to create an inclusive workplace at GSK. If you require any assistance, either to attend an interview or during the course of the recruitment process, please let us know. Why GSK Uniting science, talent, and technology to get ahead of disease together At GSK, we have already delivered unprecedented change over the past four years, improving R&D, becoming a leader in Consumer Healthcare, strengthening our leadership, and transforming our commercial execution. Now, we’re making the most significant changes we’ve made to our business in over 20 years. We’re on track to separate and create two new companies in 2022: New GSK with a leading portfolio of vaccines and specialty medicines as well as R&D based on immune system and genetics science; and a new world-leading consumer healthcare company of loved and trusted brands. With new ambition comes new purpose. For New GSK, this is to unite science, talent, and technology to get ahead of disease together – all with the clear ambition of delivering human health impact; stronger and more sustainable shareholder returns; and as a new GSK where outstanding people thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it. How we do all this is through our people and our culture. A culture that is ambitious for patients – so we deliver what matters better and faster; accountable for impact – with clear ownership of goals and support to succeed; and where we do the right thing. So, if you’re ready to improve the lives of billions, join us at this exciting moment in our journey. Join our challenge to get Ahead Together. *Li-GSK Our goal is to be one of the world’s most innovative, best performing and trusted healthcare companies. We believe that we all bring something unique to GSK and when we combine our knowledge, experiences and styles together, the impact is incredible. Site Name: Singapore - Tuas Posted Date: Feb 4 2022 Do you have an interest in Technical position where you can develop your technical and analytic skills?  If so, this is the role for you. Professional Conversion Program (PCP) is an initiative jointly supported by Workforce Singapore (WSG) and Temasek Polytechnic (TP) and is aimed at building a pipeline of skilled manpower for Singapore’s biopharmaceutical manufacturing industry in anticipation of hiring demand. The training programme is consists of a 3-months structured facilitated training conducted by TP, followed by 15 months of local attachment with GSK.  Due to the nature of the programme, we can only consider Singapore Citizens and Singapore Permanent Residents. For more information, please visit A certificate will be given to successful trainees upon completion of the programme. The role We are looking for a Process Engineer who is keen to provide process and technical support to Manufacturing Operations teams to enable Value Stream to deliver its operational objectives. Areas of support includes process optimization, validation activities, continuous improvement, change management, deviation investigation and production project management to ensure that Value Stream can operate optimally and in compliance cGMP requirements We are looking for you with below attributes: A Bachelor Degree in Chemical Engineering or any Science/engineering related field Problem solving and analytical skills MS offices suits of software Other requirements: Singaporean (core priority) or Singapore PR only – for Program and Grant requirement For male applicants: completed National Service within 60 months prior to course start. Where will I be based? You will be based at one of our manufacturing sites in Singapore near Tuas. When can I start? PCP Program starts in May 2022 (tentatively), while the On the Job training start in Aug 2022. How can I apply? Applications are now open. Click on the button above to apply. Applications close 15 Mar 2022 (We recommend you apply as soon as possible, because we accept ongoing applications and offer positions on a first come, first served basis!) At GSK we value diversity and treat all candidates equally. We strive to make our recruitment process free of bias of any kind and aim to create an inclusive workplace at GSK. If you require any assistance, either to attend an interview or during the course of the recruitment process, please let us know. Why GSK Uniting science, talent, and technology to get ahead of disease together At GSK, we have already delivered unprecedented change over the past four years, improving R&D, becoming a leader in Consumer Healthcare, strengthening our leadership, and transforming our commercial execution. Now, we’re making the most significant changes we’ve made to our business in over 20 years. We’re on track to separate and create two new companies in 2022: New GSK with a leading portfolio of vaccines and specialty medicines as well as R&D based on immune system and genetics science; and a new world-leading consumer healthcare company of loved and trusted brands. With new ambition comes new purpose. For New GSK, this is to unite science, talent, and technology to get ahead of disease together – all with the clear ambition of delivering human health impact; stronger and more sustainable shareholder returns; and as a new GSK where outstanding people thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it. How we do all this is through our people and our culture. A culture that is ambitious for patients – so we deliver what matters better and faster; accountable for impact – with clear ownership of goals and support to succeed; and where we do the right thing. So, if you’re ready to improve the lives of billions, join us at this exciting moment in our journey. Join our challenge to get Ahead Together. *Li-GSK Our goal is to be one of the world’s most innovative, best performing and trusted healthcare companies. We believe that we all bring something unique to GSK and when we combine our knowledge, experiences and styles together, the impact is incredible. Come join our adventure at GSK where you will be inspired to do your best work for our patients and consumers. A place where you can be you, feel good and keep growing. Company Description You’re talented and adaptable. That’s why you’ll fit in. As well as discovering, mining and processing many of the essential raw materials that enable, support and enhance modern life, our global business is involved in selling and marketing products – copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore, coal, nickel and diamonds. Through our Marketing Business, we are able to offer innovative solutions to meet our customers’ specific challenges. This includes physical products, logistics and technical support, as well as pricing and financing solutions. Job Description What you’ll do In this role you will partner the Marketing Business to create a talented, diverse, capable and highly engaged collaborative Business Unit that is focused on achieving the evolving Business Objectives and driving an agile, innovative and high performing culture. Key Responsibilities Lead and drive the execution of complex projects from initiation to completion - including roadmap structure, work plan development and project management with global stakeholders to ensure timely implementation of every tranche of the project. Accountable for project plan and delivery for organization change within Marketing As the key focal point, enable cross-functional projects and programs effectively and efficiently by escalating risks, tracking decisions, empowering decision-makers, identifying interdependencies and ensuring there is consistent and regular engagement on the changes Negotiating with stakeholders on project priorities and influencing/gaining buy-in from executive sponsors, team members, stakeholders and peers Partner with relevant stakeholders to review business requirements, design solutions, test plans, and drive change management and training activities Coaching and mentoring team members on emerging People technologies, delivery methods and project best practices Design content for leaders and facilitate working sessions with the change management steering committee for all projects Partner Talent and Learning team to identify capability gaps and develop a capability development plans to support teams through organisation change Qualifications What we’re looking for Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Human Resources or relevant disciplines Operations: Project Management Management: Change Management, Stakeholder management Learning and Development Make full use of learning and development strategy, frameworks and best practice to deliver effective, accessible development solutions which have a measurable impact on individual, team and organisational performance. Talent Management Understands and embeds talent management strategy, processes and tools to attract, engage, retain and develop individuals in line with Anglo American’s current and future requirements. Project Management Applies project management standards, tools and techniques to ensure delivery of HR projects on time and within budget which deliver quality outcomes in line with stakeholder expectations and business requirements. Organisation Change & Development Applies knowledge of change management, organisation behaviour, employee engagement and organisation effectiveness to enhance individual, team and business performance, driving change and delivering business strategy through a holistic, ‘system-wide’ view of the organisation. Additional Information Who we are Anglo American is a global diversified mining business. Our portfolio of world-class mining operations provides the metals and minerals that make modern life possible. We use innovative practices and the latest technologies to discover new resources and mine, process, move and market our products to our customers around the world. As a responsible miner – of diamonds (through De Beers), copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore, coal and nickel – we are the custodians of what are precious natural resources. We work together with our key partners and stakeholders to unlock the sustainable value that those resources represent for our shareholders, the communities and countries in which we operate and for society at large. Anglo American is re-imagining mining to improve people’s lives. What we offer Competitive salary and benefits package Amazing opportunities for learning and growth - from technical training to leadership programs, we bring out the best in our people We’re a large, successful multinational company and there are plenty of opportunities internally to move onwards and upwards too Inclusion and Diversity Anglo American is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are and provide equality of opportunity so that everyone can fulfil their potential. Covid Vaccination Intent Since safe and effective COVID-19 vaccines have become widely available this year, we have strongly encouraged employees to get vaccinated at the earliest possible opportunity. However, as vaccines have been proven to be a very effective and safe way of protecting people and reducing Covid-19 transmission, we have now announced our intent to introduce a policy that requires Covid-19 vaccination for access to all sites and offices. This policy would apply to all new joiners to the company as well as existing employees and contractors. We are in the process of undertaking a comprehensive engagement process with all our stakeholders about our intent. This is so we can tailor our approach in each country, including ensuring what we do is lawful. Once this is complete, we will look to implement the policy. There may be differences in how and when it is implemented due to local context and legal requirements. How to apply To apply for this role, please complete our online application form. You will have the opportunity to upload your CV and other relevant documentation as part of this process. Recommended Skills Business Administration Business Requirements Capability Development Change Management Coaching And Mentoring Employee Engagement

The Account and Partner Management team is a sales team that is part of Facebook’s Global Business Group. This team is focused on connecting every business in the world with their customers on Facebook and then helping them grow through solutions like Facebook Pages and Advertising. Account Managers are directly responsible for building relationships and helping clients grow their own business results on Facebook through consultation, education, and support. Ideal candidates will have the ability to drive marketing strategy coupled with a willingness to roll up their sleeves and execute their sales tactics. Success in this position requires exceptional consultative sales, coaching, and client service skills; a willingness to experiment; the ability to thrive in a dynamic, team-focused environment; and a passion for helping others to achieve results. This position is full-time and located in our Singapore Office. Become an expert in Facebook’s digital marketing solutions for small and medium clients and adapt recommendations quickly to suit varying client needs Grow revenue, educate and lead strategic conversations with small and medium clients, and manage complex relationships Demonstrate vertical expertise in all matters relevant to your book of business, including escalation and troubleshooting to resolve client issues Work with small and medium clients to improve the performance of their overall Facebook campaigns BA/BS degree 3+ years of experience in account management, brand management, performance marketing, digital marketing, sales or consulting Strong communication skills Fluency in Vietnamese language & knowledge of Vietnam market are essential as the role requires to manage local accounts & communicate business strategy in local language Ability to effectively prioritise and manage tasks within a fast-paced environment while maintaining strict attention to detail Structured problem solving and quantitative analytical skills Sales discipline and feel aspired to go after sales goals Your browser doesn't support mapbox-gl library. About Great Eastern Established in 1908, Great Eastern places customers at the heart of everything we do. Our legacy extends beyond our products and services to our culture, which is defined by our core values and how we work. As champions of Integrity, Initiative and Involvement, our core values act as a compass, guiding and inspiring us to embrace the behaviours associated with each value, upholding our promise to our customers - to continue doing our best for them in a sustainable manner. We work collaboratively with our stakeholders to look for candidates who exhibit or have the potential to embrace our core values and associated behaviours, as these are the key traits that we expect from our employees as they develop their careers with us. We embrace inclusivity, giving all employees an equal opportunity to shine and play their role in exploring possibilities to deliver innovative insurance solutions. Since 2018, Great Eastern has been a signatory to the United Nations (UN) Principles of Sustainable Insurance. Our sustainability approach around environmental, social, and governance (ESG) considerations play a key role in every business decision we make. We are committed to being a sustainability-driven company to achieve a low-carbon economy by managing the environmental footprint of our operations and incorporating ESG considerations in our investment portfolios; improving people’s lives by actively helping customers live healthier, better and longer; and drive responsible business practices through material ESG risk management. Our innovative solutions enable our hosts and vendors’ partners to liberate the consumers to move without fear and move with hope and anticipation of what’s to come. Since our launch, we have become the fastest-growing relocation platform in the region, helping over 12,000 families relocate globally across 200 cities. We have global ambitions and are up against international incumbents in a rapidly emerging field! With our emphasis on innovation and automation, we have devised revolutionary products to make international relocation easier, smarter and stress-free. We are scaling fast and expanding into the US, UK, EU, and India markets and are looking for passionate talent to be part of this exciting journey. If you want to learn, grow and deliver, if you are results-oriented, love teamwork, appreciate open communication, learning, and iteration, and making decisions with data, come and join our tribe and be part of our growing Moovaz team! Job Description We are looking for an enthusiastic and hackish Growth Marketing Intern to join our young and energetic team to embark on our revolutionary charge! Get hands-on with real-world marketing work and be exposed to digital and guerrilla marketing techniques as you spend time with us. You will be conceptualizing, developing, and executing marketing campaigns to achieve lead generation efforts and increase Moovaz brand awareness. As a Growth Marketing intern, you will be cross-collaborating with the different teams in Moovaz in all stages of marketing and demand lead generation campaigns. You will be expected to brainstorm on creative and ground-breaking ideas and be hands-on in driving the marketing projects. This internship will help you acquire relevant skills and knowledge in all aspects of marketing. You will also get a deeper understanding of how to drive business growth and gain skills to equip you in excelling in a fast-paced work environment. Responsibilities Conceptualize, develop and execute marketing and leads generation campaigns across B2C and B2B channels Generate new ideas and drive continual optimization of online and offline marketings to build our brand, content, and community Analyze, hypothesis and test to optimize customer journey through the entire marketing funnel to entire commercial effectiveness and overall growth of new product and markets Explore your creativity by being hands-on with the production of marketing content, graphics, and media Report and update respective manager and team members to ensure the timely and accurate development of projects Requirements Full-time internship (6 months between January - July 2022) A team player who is willing to learn and communicate across departments Able to work in smaller teams with good oversight for multiple tasks on hand An agile learner who can adapt well in a fast-growing environment while keeping attention to detail Commercially aware, self-motivated, and proactive It will be good if you have… Some experience in design, copywriting, or editorial Some experience in digital marketing Prior internship working experience in tech Startups We invite you to join us in building a life well moved! Job_Title: Analyst, Payment Processor, Cash Operation, Technology & Operations, Corporate Banking
Job_Descriptions: Analyst, Payment Processor, Cash Operation, Technology & Operations, Corporate Banking Business Function Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels. Responsibilities: • Perform day-to-day operational activities in relation to Inward Telegraphic Transfer (ITT) / Outward Telegraphic Transfer (OTT) • Ensure completeness and correctness of customer instructions before processing • Perform daily reconciliation of ITT/OTT payments • Collaborate widely with internal stakeholders and ensure that their ITT/OTT payment related queries are timely addressed, and issues timely resolved. • Ensure timely escalation of system issues and work with tech counterparts to resolve those issues • Engagement in ITT/OTT related projects/initiatives rollouts. Participate in LV testing • Engagement in Risk and Control initiatives and projects, not limited to control deep dives, pre-audit reviews, risk self-assessments, coordination of internal, external, and regulatory audits Requirements: • Minimum 2 years experience in payment processing • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and hence jobs requires the candidate to have good, in-depth understanding of swift payment format and proficient in / sound knowledge of payments processing systems (eg. SWIFT Alliance Messaging Hub (AMH), Integrated Payment Engine (IPE), OCR, FRSP) and core banking systems (e.g. CICSH) • Ability to work under stress with a sense of urgency to meet various currency cutoff times and customer's specific SLA with zero error rate. • Able to work staggered hours or on shift on rotation basis and participate in weekend LVs • Ability to work overtime (typically including, but not limited to Mondays (across weekend), post holidays, month end weeks) due to surge in volume during these periods. • Able to work on SG public holidays when the need arises • Speed & Accuracy - Role requires processing transactions at high speeds, whilst maintaining vigilance & accuracy over the manual repairs and inputs. • Zero tolerance for error/ambiguity - role entails posting financial transactions on daily basis; and entails high financial exposure risk • Comfort with variable workload that is dependent on customer payment volumes, not a fixed output per day. • Teamwork & Dependability - Staff's commitment & dependability to fulfil BAU obligations even in times of high volumes & stress • Strong risk & controls mindset and meticulous with an eye for details Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Information Security Threat Management Specialist Job Summary Singapore Permanent BBBH805965 Feb 04, 2022 S$100-149k Job Description Assistant Vice President / Vice President, Information Security Threat Management Specialist (Application Monitoring & Response), Global Information Security Job Description Your background Strong hands-on experience in application security detection and response technologies and processes Understanding of common exploits, web application attacks, network protocols and infrastructure/application logs (eg weblogs, AD logs, security logs) for an efficient intrusion analysis Advanced log analysis skills leveraging tools such as Splunk or other SIEM solutions to find targeted attacks and hunting exercises Comfortable with scripting languages and regular expressions Working knowledge of common operating systems (Windows/Linux/ OS X) Experience in packet captures and analysis (e.g. Wireshark) is desirable Ability to independently work in a fast-paced environment and drive continuous improvement Relevant technical certifications (SANS, CISSP, etc.) desirable Excellent communication skills, able to adapt a message to various audiences What you can expect The Global Information Security (GIS) team is responsible for protecting bank information systems, confidential and proprietary data, and customer information. The Cyber Security Defence (CSD) team aims to protect the bank by having an end-to-end view and influence over all security controls at the Bank. The CSD Information Security Threat Management team specifically aims to reduce risk across the Bank by leveraging multiple methods of application layer intrusion detection, prevention and response activities for the security, safeguarding, continuity and confidentiality of information at Bank. As senior member of the team, you can expect yourself to be on forefront of application security detection and response practice while collaborating with other security teams. The CSD team operates in FTS (follow the sun) model among Singapore, UK and US. We are a front line team that handles active security events and highly current threats. On call and after-hours work can be expected although we rotate to approximately one week every 2 months. What you will do Analyze application layer alerts, conduct investigations, respond to disrupt malicious actions of threat actors and feedback to improve defensive capabilities Leverage advanced investigative skills using best in class data correlation and network/packet analysis tools to investigate incidents Provides leadership in assessing new threat vectors and leverage new intelligence to update existing controls or design new controls Develop and implement custom alerts and dashboards monitoring controls based on OSI layer 7 attack and threat indicators Responsible for mentoring and developing the skill sets of less experienced team members Develops and implements processes or controls in support of audit, compliance and risk requirements Partner with senior leaders of business organizations to triage security events and report on impact Execute and improve relevant risk management strategies

As an Android App Developer, you will be responsible for end-to-end development of Sephora’s new Android Mobile App for SEA markets. This is an exciting opportunity to be involved in a pivotal project since early stage. You will be directly involved in setting the foundations for the Android App in the concept-definition stage and have the chance to drive innovation through close collaboration with other Teams (UX/UI Design, Product, Marketing). The position will be based in Singapore. You will shine here if you enjoy…     Participate in full Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) for the Android Application     Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design and implement new features     Integrate with backend APIs and external data sources     Develop with strong testing culture with both unit and integration tests     Work with project stakeholders to develop automated Acceptance tests     Optimize for availability, performance and memory management     Be responsible for delivering project milestones     Continuously discover, evaluate, propose and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency     Embrace and add value to a team that practices Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration pipeline, Agile development framework, manual and automated peer reviews. We would love to hear from you if…     Strong CS fundamentals, Up-to-date on Android programming development and Kotlin programming language features     Minimum 5 years’ experience in Android development with a track record of building and maintain complex applications.     Passionate about mobile technologies and using them to drive the business forward     Bachelor or higher degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics or related qualifications     Previous experience in developing e-commerce Mobile Apps highly preferred     Strong technology background, well-versed with mobile architectures, trends and emerging technologies     Familiar with MVVM, Clean Architecture     Solid understanding of the full mobile development life cycle     Experience in Kotlin Multi-Platform/Backend development is a strong advantage     UI optimization for multiple screens While at Sephora, you’ll enjoy…     The people: You will be surrounded by some of the most talented, supportive, and kind leaders and teams – people you can be proud to work with.     The learning: We invest heavily in training for our leaders and store associates. Not just product knowledge but building a personalized career plan with you so you continue to evolve and build your skills.     The culture: As a leading beauty retailer, backed by the LVMH luxury brand, our reach is broad, and our impact is global. Yet there’s always room to explore. It’s in our DNA to innovate and, at Sephora, all 40,000 passionate team members are united by a common goal - to reimagine the future of beauty. You can unleash your creativity, because we’ve got disruptive spirit. You can learn and evolve, because we empower you to be your best. You can be yourself, because you are what sets us apart. This is the future of beauty. Reimagine your future, at Sephora. When joining Sephora, you join the fastest growing and most innovative omnichannel retailer in South East Asia. As part of LVMH, (www.lvmh.com/group), we provide an unparalleled combination of resources, scale, and autonomy to our employees. Sephora SEA was created through the combination of the Sephora's retail business in South East Asia and Luxola, a Singaporean start-up that broke new frontiers in ecommerce regionally. We proudly maintain an entrepreneurial and technology-focused culture, with all our capabilities built in-house – a rarity in this region. The data is definitive: diversity leads to better teams, better performance, and better results. Consequently, we actively seek to hire employees of all genders, backgrounds, and experiences.  We provide our employees with a unique opportunity to take on senior responsibilities, accelerate their career path, and impact the business of beauty across the world.

Job Purpose You will be part of the GRM Enterprise System Management team to drive positive change in the division through adoption of new technology and improvement of internal processes as well as continuous support of GRM enterprise systems. The Job Assist to drive the implementation of enterprise systems within Group Risk Management. Be the subject matter expert for GRM enterprise system related functionalities and bridge users with Group IT and any other relevant external parties on the business requirements and technical designs. Assist to drive adoption of new technology and digital transformations (such as AI/ML projects, data analytics) within GRM to improve effectiveness and efficiency. Handle complex / group-wide risk and control issues in respect of the GRM enterprise systems. Lead and carry out project management activities for initiatives relating to GRM enterprise systems, relevant process enhancement as well as new technology adoption. Manage and document the GRM enterprise compliance system related policies, workflow and procedures. Review and sign-off GRM enterprise systems related deliverables. Provide advisory to users on GRM enterprise systems related matters and recommend mitigation solutions for cross-functional issues where required. Provide technical training to users on GRM enterprise systems or any other relevant applications systems when required. Carry out ad-hoc tasks/ projects as required by Head of Group AML/CFT Compliance. Takes accountability in considering business and regulatory compliance risks and takes appropriate steps to mitigate the risks. Maintains awareness of industry trends on risks, regulatory compliance, emerging threats and technologies in order to understand the risk and better safeguard the company. Highlights any potential concerns /risks and proactively shares best risk management practices. Our Requirements Bachelor Degree in IT or Business Management or Finance with minimum of 7 years working experience in the area of risk & compliance system implementation, process improvement, project management or analytics, preferably for insurance-related companies. Sound IT knowledge, including risk and compliance systems architecture and functionalities as well as analytics/big data platform. Ability to understand and/or write IT programming language especially for analytics purposes (e.g. SQL, Python, R). Competent in technical engagement execution, planning and review. Strong project management and stakeholder management skills. Broad knowledge of business, products and operations of the financial services industries (either banks, insurance and capital market firms), familiar with risk and compliance processes will be an added advantage. Good interpersonal & communication skills, able to handle difficult situations, adaptable to fast-pace environment and able to work under pressure to meet tight deadlines. Resourceful, proactive and able to work independently as well as in a team. High level of integrity, takes accountability of work and good attitude over teamwork. Takes initiative to improve current state of things and adaptable to embrace new changes. About Great Eastern Established in 1908, Great Eastern places customers at the heart of everything we do. Our legacy extends beyond our products and services to our culture, which is defined by our core values and how we work. As champions of Integrity, Initiative and Involvement, our core values act as a compass, guiding and inspiring us to embrace the behaviours associated with each value, upholding our promise to our customers - to continue doing our best for them in a sustainable manner. We work collaboratively with our stakeholders to look for candidates who exhibit or have the potential to embrace our core values and associated behaviours, as these are the key traits that we expect from our employees as they develop their careers with us. We embrace inclusivity, giving all employees an equal opportunity to shine and play their role in exploring possibilities to deliver innovative insurance solutions. Since 2018, Great Eastern has been a signatory to the United Nations (UN) Principles of Sustainable Insurance. Our sustainability approach around environmental, social, and governance (ESG) considerations play a key role in every business decision we make. We are committed to being a sustainability-driven company to achieve a low-carbon economy by managing the environmental footprint of our operations and incorporating ESG considerations in our investment portfolios; improving people’s lives by actively helping customers live healthier, better and longer; and drive responsible business practices through material ESG risk management. To all recruitment agencies: Great Eastern does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our email or our employees. We will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Business Integrity's mission is to ensure safe and trusted connections between people, businesses, and Meta. Our team works together to anticipate and predict potential threats to our platform, design and build tools to protect against these threats, and then implement and enforce these systems at scale. We leverage data analysis, machine learning and a robust infrastructure to review the quality of promoted content on our platform. We partner closely with several cross-functional teams, including product, engineering, and data science, to ensure high quality and safe experiences for both people and businesses across the Meta family of apps. Successful candidates for this team are adaptable, creative, have a bias toward action, aren't afraid of being wrong, and can successfully work across various teams & countries. Partner with cross-functional teams such as Product, Engineering, and outsourced vendors to lead or coordinate large-scale strategic projects as well as solve ongoing operational problems at scale Inform, influence, and execute new strategies and tactics using sound analysis and impact metrics to support your positions Leverage data-informed insights to drive new products and initiatives Work with data and measurement partners to identify and track key program performance indicators, and ensure the results contribute to overall company, product, customer, and community experience goals Identify trends to enhance processes and improve team efficiency Manage, coordinate, and/or support policy enforcement projects as needed 2+ years of experience in product/program management or related field Analytical skills, with experience solving problems using data and providing practical business insights/cases Experience influencing data, business, and engineering teams through an understanding of business and ecosystem needs Experience working with international or cross-functional teams Experience resolving and communicating about issues with both technical and non-technical audiences Experience being a “connector” across teams and managing a program/project against KPIs through to completion Experience performing analytics work or manipulating data sets Experience with SQL Understanding of relevant landscapes including ad tech, outsourcing, policy, and spam/fraud Experience working with or in support of diverse communities Your browser doesn't support mapbox-gl library. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Palola is an artisanal footwear design and manufacturing label that handcrafts stock and Made-To-Order women’s footwear at our in-house atelier. Palola was founded in Singapore in 2016, by 2 Singaporean craftsmen who had a shared vision to mend the broken bond between the wearer of the footwear and the shoemaker. For years, footwear brands moved away from traditional shoemaking, and started industrialising shoemaking processes. This resulted in footwear that were made by factory workers in assembly lines instead of shoemakers who understood the wearers’ feet, and how to make footwear that would look good and fit well. Bespoke shoemaker Josh Leong, honed his craft at Italian bespoke shoemaker, Stefano Bemer, and currently heads the shoemaking team at Palola. Together with Jeremiah from The J.Myers Company, the founders have more than a decade’s worth of experience between them, and they set out to create a brand of footwear centred around style, but more importantly, comfort and craftsmanship. The Role The role we are looking to fill is for a retail associate position at the Palola retail boutique. Singaporean ladies footwear brand Palola is looking for new full-time Retail Ambassadors to join our team. Job description for Retail Ambassador role: Retail Ambassadors are responsible for greeting customers, answering questions, offering assistance, suggesting items, lending opinions and providing product information. Retail Ambassadors' responsibilities include: Demonstrating outstanding customer service and selling skills Keeping the retail display shelves stocked with merchandise Regular stocktaking to ensure that inventory is up-to-date Packing online purchases and liaising with courier for deliveries Keeping the retail boutique and stock room clean and tidy Working hours: Up to 44 hours / week (shift work) Each retail shift is from 12pm - 8pm (weekdays) / 11am - 8pm (weekends) 2 off days / week (8 off days / month) Salary: S$1,800 - S$2,200 / month + attractive retail commission Ideal Profile Requirements: Retail Ambassadors must display a professional attitude with sincerity and enthusiasm reflecting our brand's commitment to our customers. In addition, they should possess these qualities and characteristics: Approachable and customer-oriented Detail-oriented and meticulous Independent and self-motivated What's on Offer? Attractive retail commission Vibrant company culture with opportunities for career growth Immerse yourself in the artisanal craft of shoemaking

Job_Title: Site Reliability Engineer - Secdb SRE - Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Site Reliability Engineer - Secdb SRE - Singapore Overview Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) is an engineering discipline that combines software and systems engineering to build and run large-scale, massively distributed, fault-tolerant systems. At Goldman Sachs, SRE is responsible for the availability and reliability of our firm's most critical platform services, and ensures they meet the requirements of our internal and external users. We look for engineers who are motivated to collaborate with our businesses to build and run sustainable production systems, which can evolve and adapt to changes in our fast-paced, global business environment. Skills and Experience Proficient in at least one programming language Ability to handle multiple on-going assignments and be able to work independently in addition to contributing as part of a highly collaborative and globally dispersed team Strong analytical skills with the ability to break down and communicate complex issues, ideas and solutions Willingness to learn new languages and programming paradigms (functional programming for example) Previous experience in a blameless SRE environment would be a plus Previous Linux exposure or willingness to learn Preferred Qualifications Degree in computer science or engineering, or equivalent industry experience Works effectively and thrives in a team while able to operate independently, self-motivation is essential Strong verbal and written communication skills
