Job description BigCommerce’s mission is to help merchants sell more at every stage of growth, from small startups, to mid-market businesses to large enterprises. We focus on being the best ecommerce platform so our customers can focus on what matters most: growing their businesses. We are equally passionate about growing our employee’s careers and providing them an incredible experience as we rapidly expand across the globe. We are proud to have been  recognized numerous times  for our product and workplace culture. We empower our people and customers to build, innovate and grow, so together we can redefine the ecommerce industry. BigCommerce is seeking a Senior Technical Recruiter to support its Product Engineering teams. As a Senior Technical Recruiter, you are an advisor, hunter, and closer. You'll develop sourcing strategies that will help our teams hit their ambitious goals.  From sourcing and screening to crafting long-term consultative partnerships with our teams, this role will be key to driving the expansion and growth of our internal BigCommerce community.  S/he will be expected to recruit and hire world-renowned Saas candidates. This person will need to be well-versed in all aspects of talent acquisition including client management and offer negotiation, candidate development, generation, and creative sourcing. What you'll do: Full-cycle recruitment (sourcing, screening, closing) for multiple roles and teams Software Engineering will be the primary focal point for this position. Partnering with your client groups to understand priorities, team goals, company culture, position profile, and other key success factors Development of robust, multi-channel sourcing strategies that will attract the best in market talent.  Specifically in the areas of Software Engineering. Managing hiring manager expectations and developing an unbiased and efficient interview process Organize strategic recruiting events to help us grow the Bigcommerce employment brand within the community through traditional and non-traditional recruiting methods. Actively plan outreach campaigns to groups and help us drive brand awareness. Conduct research on target companies and candidates, leveraging tools like LinkedIn Recruiter Always be mindful in prospecting for DEI applicants to increase DEI top of funnel Using a data-driven approach to optimize the hiring funnel Building an inclusive workforce Who You Are: 7+ years of experience with full life-cycle recruiting for strong talent across all technical areas. Strong understanding of the current talent market in Austin, Texas and San Francisco. Previous experience recruiting the "best of the best"  talent in the market A large network of candidates that you have maintained contact with over the last few years. Experience sourcing and engaging top-quality candidates regularly (not just posting to job boards) Verbal and written communication Strong research skills and the ability to research target companies and candidates, leveraging online resources (LinkedIn, social media, Boolean search queries, etc.) to find passive candidates A consultative mindset to diagnose challenges and problem solve Experience recruiting within high-growth, start-up environments - coming from SaaS, software, internet, or social media company highly desired Strong interviewing skills, both in-person and over the phone -- the ability to identify the very best talent from average talent Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Previous experience using a Candidate Management and/or Applicant Tracking software tool (we use Greenhouse) (This role will primarily support our Sydney office and other APAC regions, and can be based in Singapore) #LI-Remote Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at BigCommerce Our employees make the difference. At BigCommerce, we believe that celebrating the unique histories, perspectives and abilities of every employee makes a difference for our company, our customers and our community. We are an equal opportunity employer and the inclusive atmosphere we build together will make room for every person to contribute, grow and thrive. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the interview process, to perform essential job functions and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. If you need an accommodation in order to interview at BigCommerce, please let us know during any of your interactions with our recruiting team. Learn more about the BigCommerce team, culture and benefits at  https://careers.bigcommerce.com .

Job_Title: Assistant Vice President - Compensation & Benefits Specialist
Job_Descriptions: Asia & Oceania Administration Department - People Planning Section Overview of Division/Department Human Resources (HR) is responsible for managing, implementing and executing various HR functions in the Singapore office. There are 3 sections in HRD- People Experience, People Planning and People Development People Planning covers human resource planning and advisory, governance and rewards. It may deploy data analytics, organizational design and change management, and implement steps to effect organizational change. It draws up frameworks of workforce management and organization development as well as governance on HR issues. Company Profile Mizuho Bank, Ltd. is a subsidiary of the Japan-based Mizuho Financial Group, Inc. (listed on the Tokyo Stock Exchange and NYSE) and is one of the largest financial services companies in the world. Mizuho Bank, Ltd. provides financial and strategic solutions for the increasingly diverse and sophisticated needs of its clients with offices located in all the major cities of the world such as Tokyo, New York, London, Hong Kong and Singapore. Job Responsibilities Your key roles & responsibilities include: As a Compensation and Benefits Specialist, you are responsible for supporting the development and implementation of performance and rewards strategy in the Asia & Oceania region. The role will work closely with the HR Business Partners and other HR specialist teams in the execution of local as well as regional HR initiatives. The key responsibilities include: Lead the implementation of job grading framework in the Asia & Oceania region. This includes development of framework and guidelines for consistent application of job grading methodology across different locations. Develop framework, policies and guidelines (including but not limited to compensation, benefits, job grading, performance management and promotion) for the Asia & Oceania region. Support the annual Performance Management, Promotion, Salary and Bonus review cycles for Singapore. Support the development of Workforce Planning and HR governance frameworks and policies. Partner with HR BPs, HR COEs (Learning, Talent Management, Recruitment and HR Analytics) and HR Shared Services on compensation, benefits, job grading, performance management, promotion, governance and data analytics matters. Act as a driver and facilitator of change management to support HR initiatives and organizational changes. Participate and support global / regional / local HR initiatives as assigned. Job Requirements What you should have: Experience and Competencies At least 8 years of HR experience with 4 - 5 years in rewards management. Job_Title: Private Banker - HNW Team - Vice President
Job_Descriptions: Private Banker - HNW Team - Vice President The Private Banker is a strategic professional who stays abreast of developments within own field and contributes to directional strategy by considering their application in own job and the business. Requires strong commercial awareness. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and external customers. Significant impact on the area through complex deliverables. Work impacts an entire area, which eventually affects the overall performance and effectiveness of the sub-function/job family. Responsibilities: Actively identify prospects and establish contact with them/convert prospects into clients. Demonstrate an in-depth understanding of clients' businesses and sources of wealth generation. Anticipate events in a client's life and business which have significant financial implications. Serve as a trusted advisor to clients who frequently seek strategic advice regarding financial matters. Build relationships with client families that cross generations to establish long-term connections to the Citi Private Bank. Effectively manage client expectations regarding what can and cannot be executed on their behalf. Maintain full understanding of client goals and risk tolerance to ensure that financial strategies are appropriate. Uncover needs that are not articulated or clearly expressed by the client. Bring together the product experts to develop long-term solutions to strengthen relationships with the firm. Help clients achieve broad financial/investment goals related to the creation and management of wealth. Develop tailored solutions that address clients' investment, risk management, and financing/liquidity needs. Set challenging goals, regularly monitoring progress and making adjustments to achieve objectives. Plan and prioritize daily, weekly, and monthly activities to maximize revenue growth and client satisfaction. Establish a referral network and gain introductions to potential clients which generate new sales. Close the deal, making concessions that are appropriate and in line with the fundamental interests of the Citi Private Bank. Help team members acquire the experience necessary to establish credibility with clients and intermediaries. Demonstrate strong commitment to team success and place team goals above personal achievement. Encourage team members to work together to deepen client relationships and exceed sales goals. Align complementary experiences and skill sets of team members to maximize client effectiveness. Build and maintain relationships with Business Partners, Colleagues and Staff. Build relationships/partner with support groups in Citi Private Bank to maintain control, find solutions and resolve issues. Follow standard procedures and advocate appropriate exceptions to standard practices when the bigger picture needs to be considered, and seek or grant approvals as appropriate. Ensure compliance on regulatory requirements and minimizes any potential liability for Citi. Ensure strong controls and effective operational and administrative services. Set an example of behaviour to all staff. Partner with colleagues across the Citi network to leverage capabilities and share expertise. Ensure clients are presented with seamless execution of internal processes and Citigroup services. Prioritize issues that need to be escalated, getting the appropriate people involved to expedite resolution. Understand and communicate the risk involved with various investment strategies. Establish credibility and trust with all Citi Private Bank colleagues, maintaining the highest standards of personal and professional integrity. Persevere in delivering what is promised, even when obstacles arise. Flag and report illegal or improper transactions, complying with all regulatory policies and control procedures regarding client acceptability. Understand the broad array of products and services under the Citi umbrella. Apply an in-depth level of knowledge in key investment and financing products. Develop expertise to identify business opportunities and address the unique needs of specific client segments. Keep abreast of financial industry developments and current global market conditions. Present and communicate complex financial concepts and investment strategies with the highest degree of professionalism. Seek continuous improvement, learn from mistakes and adapt behaviour, based on feedback from clients and colleagues Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. Qualifications: 7-10 years of experience Extensive and proven experience in Retail or Private Banking having covered the HNW market in client management or product specialist role / Extensive experience in working with and/or leading client teams and transactions / Demonstrated track record in relationship selling Education: Bachelor's/University degree, Master's degree preferred Job Family Group: Private Client Coverage Job Family: Private Banker Time Type: Full time Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi") invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. If you are a person with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation to use our search tools and/or apply for a career opportunity review Accessibility at Citi . Security Manager- Security Defence Centre (SDC) Job Summary Singapore Permanent BBBH805945 Feb 04, 2022 S$100-149k Job Description Hiring Experts with a well-rounded skillset and diverse personalities who leverages on a variety of tools and resources to proactively detect, investigate and mitigate emerging and persistent threats As SDC team member you will be in-charge of performing investigations into cyber-security incidents involving advanced and sophisticated threat actors and related TTPs. Your key role will be planning and facilitating all the activities involved in the incident response, threat hunting and threat management process, including exploratory analysis, Indicators of compromise matching and correlation, research and development, communication, reporting and working towards long-term remediation planning. You will be responsible to protect and maintain overall security of the enterprise. Responsibilities: Serve as the point of contact for all major incidents, ensuring that the correct process is followed for all tickets and correct any deviations. Take a leading role in coordinating during bigger cases and providing extensive view and in-depth analysis of the incident during post-incident review and root cause analysis ensuring that SLAs are complied with. Orchestrating remediation actions with various stakeholders during security incidents. Preparing Lessons Learned sessions with immediate stakeholders to evaluate incident response plan and identify gaps in process flow and practices and suggest improvements. Prepare and conduct research related to latest trends, methods, tools and tactics used in digital forensic analysis and draft investigation approach plans and execute them. Proactively hunting for threats and enabling incident management life cycle while supporting recovery efforts. Provide insightful knowledge and guidance to the colleagues engaged in prevention measures. Develop hypothesis, techniques and execute hunts to identify threats across the environment. Maintain collaborations with the security teams and business stakeholders to implement countermeasures and improve defences. Active participation and involvement in group discussion and provide with current updates on emerging threats and cyber related risks. Proactively coordinate with immediate stakeholders - technical and business stakeholders and manage internal and external partnerships during a security incident. Create precise and factual reports and documentation of critical findings and present those findings to team and senior management on a routine basis. Interface with teams on a regional and local level and improve on the standards and guidelines principles on the Emergency processes. General Knowledge and Skills Proven Subject Matter Expert in Security/Cybercrime/Forensics/Anti-Fraud (CISSP, GIAC, CEH) Deep understanding of malicious activities related to intrusion analysis, tactics, techniques and procedures, incident response framework and kill chain phases. Knowledge of security architecture, system administration, operating system and networking (protocols, designs, SMTP, HTTP) Knowledge of security technologies and architecture including encryption, network security, firewall configuration, intrusion detection, data loss prevention, access control and application security Advanced Knowledge of CSIRT frameworks, standards, and best practices Advanced Knowledge of security monitoring tools, big data analysis and procedures Advanced Knowledge of forensic tooling like FTK, encase and others Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Excellent organization skills and attention to details. Must be proactive, action-oriented and should be able to deliver results. Ability to work individually and as part of a team. If you are interested in this position, please click "Apply Now" and we will review your qualifications & reach out to you for further discussion & next steps, if your skillsets meet the needs of the role. Only shortlisted candidates will be responded to, therefore if you do not receive a response within 14 days please accept this as notification that you have not been shortlisted. Job_Title: IT Asset Decommissioning and Disposal Associate
Job_Descriptions: IT Asset Decommissioning and Disposal Associate Background on Technical Environment for this role?s team Enterprise Data Center (EDC) is a global organization responsible for the Firm?s enterprise data center portfolio. EDC is accountable for the provisioning and management of the Firm?s data centers from initial requirements, construction and fit-out, and is also responsible for the physical life cycle management of IT assets housed within. The Data Center portfolio is comprised of various data center types across the globe, ranging from dedicated owned and operated sites to colocation facilities with large and small footprints. Role Profile This role will be focused on reducing IT and operational risk to the Firm during the final stages of the IT Asset Lifecycle: IT Asset Decommissioning and Disposal. As a supervisor, the candidate will ensure all personnel reporting to them conduct themselves in a safe and professional manner, follow all safety guidelines and firm security policies and will set a personal example of these qualities at all times. The role will also be focused on fastidiously tracking asset decommissioning operations activity and documenting incident investigations. Records, including manifests, approval forms, invoices, certificates of destruction (CoDs), and images must be meticulously organized in accordance with all firm electronic communication standards. As such, the candidate will interface with and build professional relationships with EDC risk management staff and will participate in incident remediation, risk management, and regulatory projects as needed. Primary Responsibilities Event Manager will have the following responsibilities: ? Serve as main subject matter expert for the data centers he/she is responsible for. Expertise must be maintained in the following areas: o Enterprise Data Center process documents and procedure documents o Firm Electronic Communication standards and policies o Firm security standards and policies o Physical inventory spaces within the data centers he/she is responsible for o Service Level agreements with local data center service vendors (e.g. Hines, Quick). o Use of proprietary data input and reporting tools ? Train Asset Control Technicians on use of tools and data center procedures. ? Manage and ensure data input quality from staff are accurate and timely. ? Travel to local unmanned sites and conduct shipping/secure shipping of assets to manned data centers for processing. ? Ensure staff demonstrate full adherence to firm safety, security, communication, and data center policies at all times. ? Fill in for Asset Control Technicians during times of absence when necessary.

At Ultimate Performance (UP) we are hiring Personal Trainers to join our UP Singapore team. Requirements You can be as green and new to the industry as they come. Our goal would be to educate and mould you as one of the future leaders of UP, just as we have already done with some of the Trainers who joined us as Juniors on our first Junior Training Scheme in 2012. We are a meritocracy and only care about your ability to get the job done and your overall potential. ATTITUDE IS EVERYTHING. Aptitude can be taught but you do need to look hard at yourself before you apply to UP. We are not an easy company to work for because we demand that you deliver your very best performance every single time. This is the UP way and it is a non-negotiable quality that we are looking for. Alongside the right attitude, to even be considered for one of our coveted positions, we are looking for individuals who can demonstrate: Relentless hard work. That you are not frightened to reflect inwards and examine your motives. That you seek out and continue to learn from your own mistakes. An investment in others. Ambition and persistence in your desire to better yourself. The ability to provide U.P. clients’ a great service and high professional standards. Benefits So, if you are interested in a role that will allow you to: Work alongside some of the leading trainers in the fitness industry as a team. Work in a culture where results - not numbers - are the name of the game. We take care of the sales and marketing so you have the time to focus on what matters as a Trainer. Take part in a full education program while also being provided your own mentor. Have the support and guidance to build a genuine career within the fitness industry, so that you can grow into the right long-term role for you. Deliver personal training through our own company app, while we continue to work behind the scenes to revolutionize the technology available to you as a Trainer. Be pushed to never accept anything less than your very best. Be provided with the possibility to travel around the world. Then hit APPLY today to be considered and discuss further with the UP team! UP does not provide Personal Trainer qualifications and so requires all applicants to have already attained their Level 3 Diploma in Personal Training, or equivalent qualification. Please note that all UP Trainers need a valid right to work, therefore we ask queries around this within the application process to determine whether sponsorship consideration is required by Ultimate Performance. It poses no potential limitation to your application. Your data will be stored by Ultimate Performance and will be used by our HR and recruitment teams for the purpose of managing your application. You can find out more about how we use your data during our recruitment process here: https://ultimateperformance.com/terms-conditions * Hours: full-time, including early mornings and late evenings in your first year of service. Advertised earnings are reflective of the advertised U.P. location’s OTEs for Junior Trainer roles in the local currency, dependent on the Junior level offered if successful.

At Blueground, our vision is to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. For us, that means ensuring our guests have the peace of mind, flexibility & confidence they need to explore life’s latest adventure. We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013, having raised more than $258m+ in funding, to date -- and that’s just the beginning. We’re now hosting guests in more than 5,000 homes in 15 cities, with an aim to hit 50 cities by 2025. Our vision comes to life through our ways of working. For our 500+ member team located across 9 countries, we’ve created a culture of collaboration, inclusiveness, and opportunity. We believe our people should have the power to choose their preferred way to work. Depending on the role’s requirements, team members can choose to work full time in one of our offices, work fully remote, or choose a hybrid model between the two. We are driven by our core values. To our team, Time is our most important resource. Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our guests and colleagues. Our relationships are built around Transparency, which builds trust and improves communication. We’re shaping the future of living, and we want you to be part of that journey. We are looking for a General Manager for our imminent launch in the city of Singapore . The GM position is one of the most exciting and impactful roles at Blueground. As the leader of the Singapore office and a member of Blueground’s global leadership team, you will own your P&L and manage all business activities: from hiring your team, to on-boarding and marketing units, to building strong relationships with the local real estate industry. You will be responsible for launching, scaling and owning the Singapore market. If you like ownership, leadership and hustling, while being very strategic and analytical in your approach, this is the right role for you. What you will focus on: Owning the P&L for Blueground's Singapore business Building and scaling a best-in-class team for real estate, operations and sales Defining city priorities and goals, and managing performance on a monthly and quarterly basis by setting relevant KPIs and incentive structure Identifying unexplored opportunities and adapting the business model to local requirements, taking into account potential regulatory constraints Staying actively educated on Singapore real estate trends to adapt and refine leasing strategy Shaping and sharing best practices with the rest of the network towards the constant efficiency improvement of our global operations. Being the face of Blueground in Singapore - local PR and networking events Collaborating with Product, Revenue Management, Marketing, Technology and Client Experience teams to meet the needs of local market What we are looking for: Relevant experience (at least 5 years) in leadership roles and ideally managing own P&L and building a high-performing team Entrepreneurial drive, adaptability, and focus on results Ability to work independently, effectively and efficiently Demonstrated ability to lead complex operational and strategic initiatives Analytical and data-driven decision making Fluency in both English and Mandarin A team player that will fit with our values and add to our culture Your benefits: Competitive salary Discretionary annual bonus scheme Stock options plan Flexible paid time off Enhanced parental leave Dynamic working environment with talented people Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in LA and winter in Dubai At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the center of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

Job_Title: Product Manager, Corporate Trust - Global Transaction Services (GTS)
Job_Descriptions: Product Manager, Corporate Trust - Global Transaction Services (GTS) Business Function Global Transaction Services (GTS) comprises of Cash & Trade, Securities Services and Fiduciary Services. In an increasingly borderless world marked by burgeoning trade flow, expertise in trade finance services is an invaluable asset. With cash the lifeblood of every company, so too, is a good understanding of how to manage these cashflows. Trade Finance, together with Cash Management, is the mainstay of GTS, and is extended to SME and corporate clients for their local and cross-border financial transaction needs. Job Purpose To be responsible for the client servicing and day-to-day administration of the REIT/Trust/Agency business. Provide guidance and technical support to the team on operational, risk and compliance issues. Key Accountabilities To lead, manage and coach a team of corporate trust administrators (where applicable) To provide inputs on operational matters to the Trust Structuring team when reviewing legal documentation for onboarding of new trust and agency matters To oversee and ensure proper implementation and compliance of our policies and procedures including key operating procedures and internal control procedures relating to the trust structures To review and ensure quality and consistency in delivery of service standards to clients Ensure periodic reviews of policies and procedures, manuals, operating memoranda and administration documents To maintain DBS internal control standards, including the timely implementation of internal and external audit points together with any issues raised by external auditors/regulators To prevent or minimize errors in the business processes that may lead to exposure to risks of financial or reputational loss Responsibilities Engage stakeholders for the preparation and drafting of operating memorandum or any other document relating to the delivery of service standards by the corporate trust and agency team Identify areas for improvement and implement solutions to increase efficiencies within the corporate trust and agency team or across business units; Ensure compliance with all laws, regulations and rules governing DBS Trustee Limited as a Licensed Trust Company and Approved Trustee; Control and monitor all areas of risk and compliance, including, inter alia, periodic reviews, investment reviews, and new business implementation; Provide guidance and technical support on fiduciary, compliance and risk issues; Follow up key changes to industry standards and practices; Liaise with other parts of DBS in the definition, roll-out and implementation of group policy and procedures and the ongoing review thereof; Assist with preparation and updating of manuals, including definition of policy, risks, controls, workflows and reference to appropriate documents; Work with operations team to ensure a smooth handover of matters to the operations team Requirements Non-Technical Experience At least 6 years of relevant experience in administration of funds and trusts including S Reit and collective investment schemes Organisational skills Interpersonal skills Ability to multi-task Technical Experience Good knowledge of corporate trust business processes, standards, policies, procedures and regulations

Job_Descriptions: AVP, IT Audit Manager, Digital & Technology Audit OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. It is now the second largest financial services group in Southeast Asia by assets and one of the world's most highly-rated banks, with an Aa1 rating from Moody's. Recognised for its financial strength and stability, OCBC Bank is consistently ranked among the World's Top 50 Safest Banks by Global Finance and has been named Best Managed Bank in Singapore by The Asian Banker. Division Description Group Audit provides objective assurance that the Group functions effectively to accomplish its objectives within the established risk appetite. We adopt a risk-based systematic approach to evaluate and provide recommendations to improve the effectiveness of internal control, risk management and governance processes. Key Responsibilities: AUDIT MANAGEMENT 1. Plan and manage audit engagements and ensure that relevant technology, information and cyber risks and control gaps and lapses have been identified, appropriately assessed, and reported. 2. Conduct audits/reviews on Applications, IT Infrastructure, as well as Information, Cyber and Digitalisation risks; 3. Support business audits by providing technology audit expertise and evaluate the IT controls supporting business operations; and 4. Assist the Head of Department/Senior Audit Manager in the delivery of their role and responsibilities. STAKEHOLDER MANAGEMENT 1. Work as business partners with stakeholders across the Group, and assist the HOD/Senior Audit Manager to better manage business and Technology, Information, Cyber, and Digital risks; and 2. Communicate audits/reviews observations and writing audit and ad-hoc reports for delivery to, and agreement with, auditees. TEAM MANAGEMENT 1. Possesses qualities essential as a leader over a team of auditors for assigned audit engagements/reviews; and 2. Complete working papers for audits/reviews through documenting the work conducted, describing the work performed and the evidence that supports the observations and conclusions, as well as reviewing the work performed by other team members. Qualifications The ideal Candidate will meet the following requirements: University Degree in Computer Science or a related discipline Professional certifications such as Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) or Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) Minimum 6 years of working experience, with at least 4 years in IT audit Willing and able to operate effectively in a leadership position or a team player Independent and committed with high level of initiative Good written, verbal communication and presentation skills Strong interpersonal and communications skills High level of integrity, drive, and sense of urgency Willing to travel 10%-20% (MY/CN primarily, with occasional worldwide) At OCBC, we recognise your drive, passion and talent. We will bring out the best in you and empower you to excel. Fulfil your life goals and career ambitions with us. *We regret that only shortlisted Candidates will be notified.

Raffles Hotel Singapore welcomed guests in August 2019 after a careful and sensitive restoration breathing new life into its beautiful building. One of the few remaining great 19th century hotels in the world, the hotel is perfectly preserved both inside and out, giving it an intoxicating blend of luxury, history and classic colonial design. Its distinctive architecture, legendary heritage and iconic service continue to enthrall visitors where restored suites, new social spaces, restaurants and bars have been enhanced for discerning travellers. No visit to Singapore is complete without a stay here, where the grand historic hotel exudes old-world grandeur infused with the unique charm of the city state. Guests can experience the modern comfort and amenities presented within 115 luxuriously spacious suites complemented by our legendary 24-hour Raffles Butler Service and a heritage tour of the property by our Resident Historian. 10 restaurants and bars present both local favourites, fine dining and collaborations with internationally renowned chefs and curated classics such as the iconic Singapore Sling experience and classic Raffles Afternoon Tea amidst the colonial charm of the historic Grand Lobby. A rooftop swimming pool and state-of-the-art fitness centre provide a respite from the hustle and bustle of the city while the new Raffles Spa is a holistic sanctuary offering pampering spa experiences and renewed well-being. Guests are also invited to visit the Raffles Boutique to shop for gourmet gifts and heritage-inspired souvenirs and a revitalized Raffles Arcade showcasing an elegant mix of new-to-market, and world-renowned international brands, collectively creating a one-of-a-kind retail experience that goes beyond traditional brick and mortar shopping. Official website URL: www.rafflessingapore.com Job Purpose The position is responsible for the supervision of the pastry production for La Dame De Pic Raffles Singapore, achieving and maintaining the highest standards of food quality and guest satisfaction. Main responsibilities includes, but not limited to, marketing, staffing, quality, training and development of team members.

Hiring_Company: Smart Nation and Digital Government Office
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The position is under the Planning and Prioritisation Directorate of SNDGO, and reports to the Assistant Director (Citizen & Business Projects). The Planning the Prioritisation Directorate looks at Whole-of-Government (WOG) planning, Citizen and Business projects, corporate planning and strategy, and finance and admin for SNDGO. The candidate should be passionate about creating impact with technology. The Citizen and Business Projects teams handle the following Government-to-Citizen (G2C) and Government-to-Business (G2B) digital products and services, and you will work on one or more of these: What you will be working on LifeSG, which aims to bundle together relevant Government services for citizens at significant events and stages of their lives. This will help to provide a more seamless and convenient experience for citizens when transacting with agencies. G2C digital products such as customer relationship management solutions, file management solutions, chatbots, and booking solutions. The GoBusiness platform, which aims to be a central platform for businesses to transact with the Government. This will help provide businesses with simpler, faster and better experiences when transacting with Government agencies. Adoption of e-Payments within the Singapore Government, as part of our ambition to become cheque free and cash light, to help more citizens and businesses transact digitally in a hassle-free, seamless and secure manner. National Digital Identity (NDI) and Singpass. The NDI is a nation-wide digital identity service, which allows for single-sign-on across government and commercial digital services, and facilitates new business models through products such as digital signatures and digital wallets. The candidate will work at the cross-section between technical execution and business strategy, and is not required to develop software or hardware. The candidate will contribute to product management, working through legal regulations and policy issues, developing resourcing frameworks and negotiating cross-agency dependencies. Beyond product management, the candidate will also help to shape and implement Whole-of-Government policies to better deliver G2C and G2B digital services, e.g. reviewing whether certain products should be mandated, or if there should be further consolidate/proliferation of services at the WOG level. The role requires working across a wide range of government agencies, including working closely with the development teams in GovTech and other Government organisations such as the Public Service Division to promote deployment and adoption of the various digital products. Key Responsibilities Help to plan and execute Singapore’s strategy and roadmap to improve G2C and/or G2B services. Shape the product roadmaps for key G2C and/or G2B digital products, and drive adoption. Coordinate among different government agencies to ensure smooth execution of tasks and launch of product features. Through service journeys where relevant, design and develop internal and external process improvements across multiple organisations to deliver user-centric services. Define and own requirements, milestones, metrics and key performance indicators for G2C and/or G2B digital products adoption. Build subject matter expertise and stay up to date on technological developments in G2C and/or G2B digital products. Key skills you can develop in this role Product management, guiding and pushing the growth of digital products, alignment to management vision; Product policy, especially in the Government context, e.g. consolidation vs proliferation of services; Stakeholder engagement, working across multiple agencies, management of conflicts; Understanding of Government ICT landscape What we are looking for Preferred Qualifications Innovation Willingness to try new approaches, fail and improve, and try again. Resourceful, strong work ethic and the ability to work independently to get things done in a fast-paced environment A desire to learn and continuously improve An interest in improving service delivery processes for citizens Execution Experience working with technical development teams ICT project management, design thinking, software development skillsets, or experience in digitalising or streamlining existing services. Demonstrated success in policy formulation and implementation (policy experience in non-ICT areas would also be useful) Excellent interpersonal skills, including relationship building and collaboration within a diverse, cross-functional (technical development, business and operational) team. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, and strong writing ability. The ideal candidate will also have: 2+ years of experience in project/program management in information systems or relevant fields. Experience with enterprise-grade software development in the private or public sector. Knowledge of cybersecurity is a plus. All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Job_Descriptions: What the role is What you will be working on At Sport Singapore, we aspire to transform the nation through an active lifestyle designed around innovative, fun and meaningful sporting experiences. Sport has the unique ability to bring people together through play, regardless of age, gender, race, ability or social status. It imparts life values, nurtures character and builds resilience. It inspires and evokes the Singapore spirit through shared experiences and strengthens our national identity. We help Singaporeans Live Better Through Sport. Sport Singapore is constantly on the lookout for individuals who are passionate about what they do. Anchored in our values of Passion for Sport, Strength through Teamwork and Care for People, we believe in working and playing, not just as a team, but as a family. Responsibilities You will be working closely with internal and external stakeholders to ensure high quality of Coaching Development programs delivered. In addition, you will be part of the team to: Design, deliver and manage Coaching Development (CD) curriculum that the academy will offer. Design a progressive CD curriculum for sport coaches in various sectors, sports and levels in the coach pathway Take on the role of program manager of CD programs targeting various stakeholders Conduct needs analysis, design and implement impact measurement tools to demonstrate the impact of the Academy’s CD programs Work closely with internal and external stakeholders to ensure high quality of CD programs delivered. Conduct research to keep abreast of emerging CD best practices and implement best practices Write, present and publish research papers to promote the Academy’s vision, impact and credibility in the area of coaching skills development Establishing CD Communities of Practice for coaches Coach and/or mentor coaches from their assigned associations & sport academies to develop personalised, actionable CD training plans. What we are looking for We are looking for self-motivated individuals who value integrity, teamwork and take pride in going the extra mile to provide excellent service to stakeholders and the community. This individual should be a sport advocate through living an active lifestyle and staying active. In addition, an ideal candidate should possess the following: Background in Sport/Exercise Psychology, Sport and Physical Education. At least 8 years working experience in sport coaching or related field Demonstrated experience in coach development or education A good track record in research and publication in the domains of sport coaching, curriculum development, education or related field Demonstrated experience in developing, evaluating programmes and curriculum Coaching experience in sport teams at the local or national level preferred Good communication and interpersonal skills. Excellent project management skills The level of offer will commensurate with applicants’ experience and track records. Successful candidates will be offered a 3-year contract in the first instance.

Hiring_Company: Smart Nation and Digital Government Office
Job_Title: Manager/Senior Manager (Data Security), Government Data Office
Job_Descriptions: What the role is We want a change maker like you who is creative, collaborative and looks for challenges. You must be ready to roll up your sleeves and rally different teams across multiple agencies to meet our common mission: to speed up and ensure the adoption of data-driven decision-making within the public sector, and to realise the Government Data Strategy’s target of sharing data securely within 7 working days by 31 Dec 2020. As a Manager/Senior Manager in the Data Security team, you will be part of a dynamic and responsive team that drives how the Government manages its existing and future data security risks, while enabling greater sharing and usage of data. You will work with multiple stakeholders to develop strategies and implement initiatives to protect the Government’s data and promote the culture of using data securely across the public sector. This position reports to Deputy Director (Data Security). What you will be working on Specific Job Responsibilities: a) Develop strategies and frameworks, and conceptualise and implement initiatives to protect data and prevent data compromise, while enabling secure sharing and usage of data across the public sector. b) Work with government agencies to operationalise the data security policies and measures c) Work with agencies and stakeholders to build a culture of excellence among public officers to use data securely d) Work with stakeholders in the government’s data and ICT ecosystem (e.g. Chief Data Officers, Chief Information Officers, etc) to enhance agency data security capabilities and practices. e) Engage public officers and the general public on the government’s data security policies and practises. What we are looking for We are looking for dynamic and self-motivated individuals who value integrity, teamwork and excellence. You will be a leader in this exciting field, and need to be able to contribute both at the individual level and provide guidance to your team members. If you share our passion in shaping Singapore into a Smart Nation, we welcome you to join us! Candidates should have: 3-5 years of working experience in conceptualising and/or implementing policies Being competent in the following areas is advantageous: Background in Computer Science/Engineering, Cybersecurity, Information Security, Data Science/Engineering or related fields Good knowledge of information security. Candidates should have experience in at least two of the following: Experienced working with Security practitioners. Experienced working with Data Scientists and Data Analysts. Managed a technical implementation project or program Experience in the Governance, Risk Management and Compliance Having the following is advantageous: Information Security certification such as CISSP, CISM, CISA Background in applications development, especially information security solutions Background in data science and data platforms Experience in privacy protection technology Experience in organisation development Strong communication and interpersonal skills that can create a consensus on action from a wide spectrum of external and internal stakeholders; including multi-agency and inter-departmental teams Resourceful and proactive, particularly in proposing alternate solutions to achieve desired outcomes Attention to detail Analytical and creative Excellent written communication skills

Hiring_Company: Smart Nation and Digital Government Office
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The candidate will support the Government Data Strategy (GDS) Key Performance Indicator (KPI) efforts. These KPIs enable the Government to track progress in using data pervasively and securely, and to take intervention to becoming a public sector that is “data-driven to the core”. Through this position, the candidate will gain a good understanding of the public sector’s progress in becoming more data-driven, and gain experience in data analysis. The candidate will also coordinate a whole-of-government data collation effort involving Chief Data Officers of close to 100 agencies and thus have the opportunity to improve their communication and stakeholder management skills. What you will be working on Coordinate with multiple government agencies to support the annual GDS KPI effort. This will involve consolidating data, answering queries, and following up with agencies to clarify their data returns. Assist in the evaluation of KPI returns (e.g. whether submitted projects fulfil KPI criteria) Perform data analysis through Microsoft Excel to identify trends/ insights. Organize data at the Agency, Ministry Family and Whole-of-Government level for agency’s reference. Organize insights from data, hypotheses, and future actions into a presentation to senior executives. What we are looking for Experience in data analysis using Microsoft Excel (knowledge of pivot tables, automated data imports and macros would be pluses). Keen sense of numbers and attention to details. Experience in preparing executive reports using Microsoft PowerPoint. Good communication and relationship building skills. 2 vacancies available for the periods below: (a) January 2022 to September 2022 (9months) (b) February 2022 to May 2022 (4months)

Job_Title: Investment Management Emerging Markets Analyst/Associate/VP (China focus)
Job_Descriptions: Investment Management Emerging Markets Analyst/Associate/VP (China focus) Company Profile Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments, and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries. Department Profile Investment Management Emerging Markets Morgan Stanley Investment Management ("MSIM"), together with its investment advisory affiliates, has approximately 1,200 investment professionals around the world and operates in 23 countries with $1.5Tn in assets under management or supervision as of June 30, 2021. Morgan Stanley Investment Management strives to provide outstanding long-term investment performance, service, and a comprehensive suite of investment management solutions to a diverse client base, which includes governments, institutions, corporations, and individuals worldwide. Morgan Stanley Emerging Markets Leaders is a benchmark agnostic, concentrated, low turnover and high active share EM equities strategy. The portfolio owns best in class structural growth business for long periods of time and is looking to add China focused analyst to the team who can invest with a long-term view. The role is based out of Singapore. Responsibilities The associate will be responsible for idea generation, composing detailed investment thesis and leading company management meetings. The analyst should have strong fundamental research skills which includes understanding of long-term industry trends and focus on key business drivers. The candidate should be open to taking on additional sector and country specific responsibilities

Job_Title: Assistant VP, Personal Wealth Team Head, Personal Financial Services
Job_Descriptions: Assistant VP, Personal Wealth Team Head, Personal Financial Services Assistant VP, Personal Wealth Team Head, Personal Financial Services Posting Date: 04-Feb-2022 Location: Singapore, SG Company: United Overseas Bank Limited About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values - Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Retail function provides Personal and Business Banking customers with financial solutions tailored to their needs. We help them manage their money wisely and meet their financial goals through an extensive range of products and services. These include deposit, insurance, secured and unsecured loans, investment and wealth advisory services. Personal Financial Services We design and provide products and services that empower our customers to enjoy greater banking convenience while they extract more value from their money. In particular, we are focused on promoting and developing healthy saving and investment practices across generations. Job Responsibilities • Lead, manage and motivate team of Personal Wealth Bankers to achieve their sales targets by coaching and building an environment for learning and career progression • Formulate and execute business plans and ensure that bankers meet the professional sales standards through providing quality service and exhibiting operational effectiveness • Ensure that bankers provide customers with timely information, advice and recommendations to fit their requirements and to adhere to the Bank's internal policies, business processes and regulatory requirements including complying with the FAA and related act Job Requirements Skills and Experience • Minimum 5 years of experience in the financial services industry with a good track record in sales of wealthmanagement products • Minimum 2 years of sales management experience with strong interpersonal skills • Strong knowledge of Financial Costing, P&L management and business marketing strategies and techniques • Sound understanding of MAS / banking regulations and compliance requirements • Proven leadership and people management techniques Education • Minimum a recognised degree in a relevant field • Possess relevant CMFAS accreditation Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

Senior Manager, DevOps Release Management Job Summary Singapore Permanent BBBH805969 Feb 04, 2022 S$100-149k Job Description Singapore's leading digital insurer that offers our customers a full range of Life, Critical Illness and Investment-linked insurance products is hiring for DevOps Manager KEY ACCOUNTAIBILITIES Lead and co-ordinate the Go-Live activities including the execution of the cross-functional/cross location deployment Plans and checklists Understand and establish the continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines, feature toggling, gradual exposure, branch handling, etc. Understand and schedule the availability of resources and environments for testing. Implement and manage release processes for code through development, test, and production environments. Design and setup release / deployment cycles that is able to support multiple parallel development squads working on the same digital platform Establish release management processes that will help understand impacts of branches and code merges Lead to deliver critical fixes within hours Forward plan the release windows and cycles across a platform portfolio Identify risks, define risk mitigation plan and resolves issues through cross functions team that affect release scope, schedule and quality Measure and monitor progress to ensure application releases are delivered on time and within budget, and that they meet or exceed expectations Reconfigure existing systems, integrations, and processes, where needed, in order to achieve the release improvements to the process/outputs expectations. Introduce new process/solutions/resources where needed, in order to achieve their objectives. Coordinate release content and efforts based on the service request backlog, pending service requests, third party applications, or operating system updates Conduct Release Readiness reviews, Milestone Reviews, and Business Go/No-Go reviews with defined project/program stakeholders Produce Deployment, Run Books and Implementation Plans Provide Weekly Release Reporting to respective stakeholder groups Communicate release details and schedules to the Business as required Communicate, negotiate, plan and manage all release activities Maintain the release schedule for all core services and ensure alignment across key partners and vendors. Continually work towards making improvements in the release process Develop scripts and automation tools used to build, integrate, and deploy software releases to various platforms Participate in CAB meetings to discuss release scope and/or roadblocks Maintain a release repository and manage key information such as build and release procedures, dependencies, and notification lists across digital platform portfolios Research new software development and configuration management methodologies and technologies and analyses their application to current configuration management needs QUALIFICATIONS / EXPERIENCE & TECHNICAL SKILLS Bachelor's degree or above in Computer Science or related field At least 2-6 years of Product Go-Live release management and/or project management experience for regional scale product launches At least 8-10 years of experience in information systems operations environment, fully understand systems analysis or development Proven experience in product release management that supporting agile delivery methods Proven experience in releasing native app development in multi countries. Experience with workaround on-premise systems is desirable. Technical expertise in Linux, Docker, AWS, Infrastructure-as-a-code, CI/CD pipeline Formal project management certified is preferred Advanced knowledge of software development lifecycle Demonstrate ability to coordinate cross-functional work teams toward task completion Demonstrate effective leadership and analytical skills Advanced written and verbal communication skill is a must General PC knowledge including Microsoft Office expert level knowledge of Excel, working Knowledge of Access If you are interested in this position, please click "Apply Now" and we will review your qualifications & reach out to you for further discussion & next steps, if your skillsets meet the needs of the role.

Job_Title: Senior Manager, Sector Digitalisation & Transformation (Organisation Development
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The individual will be part of an industry development team that builds organisational capabilities for Social Service Agencies (SSAs). OD Unit strengthens organisational health of SSAs to be more effective employers and service-providers, and extends OD learnings and best practices to the sector-at-large. This job holder will support projects related to organisational health of SSAs, from design and conceptualisation through project implementation including fund management, reporting. The role serves to increase awareness of the importance of organisational health in the sector and facilitate support and guidance to SSAs in achieving it. This involves understanding key enablers and barriers to organisational and digital health specific to the sector and developing frameworks and structures to address them. With a basis grounded in diagnostics of organisational health, the role involves significant support to Account Management work with SSA leadership and staff to drive buy-in and smooth effective implementation of transformation projects, in addition to liaison with multiple stakeholders across government bodies and vendors such as consultants and researchers. The role will also be involved in the creation and championing of an ecosystem across the People, Public and Private sectors that serves to bring together partners in organisational and digital health for capability building of the sector at large. The job holder will champion and support the overall strategy and objectives of SDT Team to build capabilities of SSAs, while focusing on implementing OD projects. This will also include supporting the marketing, communications and engagement of the sector-at-large to achieve the purpose of SDT Team. The role will continually identify and avail opportunities to connect dots across Groups and functions in NCSS that bolster the capacity- and capability-building efforts of OD. What you will be working on 1) Develop and manage project processes a) Carry out desktop research and information gathering to write proposals including details around scope, funding and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and seek approval according to guidelines with support. b) Manage project schedule, budget and required communications and documentation for project success. c) Stake out the objectives of projects, and work across parties as required to achieve them. d) Incorporate elements of Change Management to varying suitable extents in programmes and interventions. 2) Develop and manage project outputs and outcomes a) Clarify, review and present interim deliverables and results of initiatives. b) Distil key progress and findings for internal and external sharing and produce the required communication (emails, presentations, data visualisations, etc.) across stakeholder groups. c) Carry out continual evaluation and improvement of programmes and interventions 3) Implement related funding parameters for the social service industry, and other areas of support in sector programme management. 4) Manage key stakeholders on a day-to-day basis, building and maintaining a sound understanding of their interests and motivations, and carrying out effective networking to build trusting and respectful professional relationships. 5) Draw and incorporate insights from gathering and analysis of data, drawing insights on capability development needs of the sector. 6) Develop and communicate strategic plans pertaining to the portfolio. 7) Drive, champion and represent the strategy, agenda and direction of SDT across NCSS, as well as externally. 8) Provide guidance to junior staff in various areas of team’s work. What we are looking for The successful applicant is an independent, driven and collaborative individual with a keen interest in, and excitement at, the prospects of Organisation Development in the Non-Profit sector. He/she has the keenness and ability to manage the complexity of issues unique to a sector with multiple sets of diverse stakeholders. He/she recognizes and leverages the value of data in programme development. He/she believes in relationship building with key stakeholders, and is driven towards collaboration both within NCSS, and externally. Skills & Competencies: 1) Knowledge and/or experience in Organisation Development, organisational transformation, strategy, Change Management and related frameworks e.g. Business Excellence. Consultancy experience in related areas is ideal. 2) Project Management skills, including Budget Management, Stakeholder Management and the ability to manage multiple timelines; 3) Strong Communication skills - written, verbal, visual and virtual; 4) Basic Data Management and Use e.g. able to perform simple queries in a database environment, ability to use Tableau and/or similar software is ideal; 5) Ability to remain agile, carrying out continual problem-solving to respond to evolving conditions and circumstances; 6) An understanding of the Social Service and/or Non-Profit sectors is ideal. 7) Knowledge and/or experience in Finance is ideal. 8) Min 3-5 years of experience. Preferably with OD-related or consulting experience.

This credit analyst role is with a strong and stable international bank located here in Singapore. This role will provide exposure to various complex scenarios and steep learning curve to the potential candidate. Our client is a global financial services group with an integrated network spanning over 30 countries. By connecting markets East & West, our client services the needs of individuals, institutions and corporate firms through it's various business divisions. In addition, they connect a diverse range of clients globally and offer them with the latest investment banking and advisory services, trading of global securities and access to their extensive insight capabilities. Description Reporting to the Head of Credit, the VP, Credit Analyst will be involved in:- Taking responsibility for all credit facility operations including underwriting and documentation for credit facilities of moderate complexity. Performing counterparty risk assessments, reviewing accounts and recommending risk ratings for financial institution counterparties. Monitoring client portfolios to ensure that credit risk arising from market sensitive exposure are controlled. Assisting and resolving problems escalated by more junior staff. Profile To qualify the potential VP, Credit Analyst should meet the following criteria:- A recognised degree from a reputable university. Minimum 8 years of relevant financial institution credit experience. Strong knowledge of industries and economic environment in the region. Strong and in-depth understanding of credit and business analysis. Job Offer Our client offers autonomy in this role reporting directly to the Head of Credit and remuneration will be in line with the market. In addition, you will be able to rely on knowledge and experience from the wider leadership team here in Singapore. To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Devan Nanthacumar on +65 6416 9879.

Hiring_Company: Smart Nation and Digital Government Office
Job_Descriptions: What the role is Funding and resource management is a strategic lever to direct efforts towards desired changes and to advance digitalisation objectives. The Finance and Resourcing team under the Planning and Prioritisation Directorate of SNDGO works with Ministry of Finance to evaluate and recommend allocation of resources to ICT&SS projects that advances Smart Nation and Digital Government ambitions. For this role, you will lead a team to review resourcing policies and manage central budgets to promote innovation and support transformative, cross-agency ICT&SS projects. Review effectiveness of existing funding framework and recommend resourcing shifts required to achieve a well-balanced portfolio of projects that achieves SNDG’s priorities. Oversee grant allocation and disbursement process, including the design and implementation of workflows, systems and accountability structure relating to the fund allocation process. Drive project portfolio performance through: (a) Working with project teams to improve business case and value proposition of key projects and initiatives (b) Providing advisory and consultations in the development of business models, funding approach and pricing strategies (c) Monitoring project progress and recommend appropriate interventions when required What we are looking for Degree in finance, economics, business administration, or equivalent practical experience At least 6 to 8 years of relevant experience in strategic planning, finance or management consulting, business intelligence or management accounting Familiar with public sector budgeting, accounting and procurement Proficient in data visualisation tools e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, is an added advantage Numerically inclined with strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities Possess intellectual curiosity, with a passion to work in a fast-paced start-up environment, comfortable with ambiguity and change Keen interest in digitalisation, good grasp of emerging digital and technology trends.

Hiring_Company: Smart Nation and Digital Government Office
Job_Title: Senior Assistant Director/Deputy Director (Data Security), Government Data Offic
Job_Descriptions: What the role is Data is fundamentally transforming our society and virtually every industry. For example, data can be used to develop AI algorithms to diagnose cancer from medical images, automate legal research, personalise Government services, and so on. Singapore has an enormous opportunity to embrace this data revolution, and harness data to power our economic growth and improve the lives of Singaporeans. The Government Data Office (GDO) is at the centre of driving this data transformation in the public sector. This includes driving data initiatives and strategies to extract the full value of data in a secure manner; working with non-Government partners on data collaborations and exchanges; and developing policies on data security, data privacy and data ethics to make sure that data is always well-protected and confidentiality is preserved. What you will be working on We want a change maker like you who is creative, collaborative and craves challenges. For this role, you will lead the Data Security team in driving the Government’s approach in managing its existing and future data security risks, while enabling greater sharing and usage of data. This will involve implementing recommendations to improve our data security regime made by the Public Sector Data Security Review Committee. You will work with multiple stakeholders to develop strategies and implement initiatives to protect the Government’s data and promote the culture of using data securely across the public sector. Specific Job Responsibilities: a) Develop strategies and frameworks, conceptualise and implement initiatives to protect data and prevent data compromise, while enabling secure sharing and usage of data across the public sector. b) Work with government agencies to operationalise the data security policies, implement recommended technical and process measures, so that their systems meet the requisite standards. c) Work with agencies and stakeholders to build a culture of excellence among public officers to use data securely. d) Work with stakeholders in the government’s data and ICT ecosystem (e.g. Chief Data Officers, Chief Information Officers, etc) to enhance agency data security capabilities and practices. e) Engage public officers and the general public on the government’s data security policies and practises. What we are looking for We are looking for dynamic and self-motivated individuals who value integrity, teamwork and excellence. You will be a leader in this exciting field, and need to be able to contribute both at the individual level and provide guidance to your team members. If you share our passion in shaping Singapore into a Smart Nation, we welcome you to join us! Candidates should have At least 8 to 10 years of working experience in conceptualising, strategizing and implementing data-related initiatives and policies, with experience in public policy and governance, as well as managerial/supervisory responsibilities. Experiences working with security practitioners, Data Scientists and Data Analysts; managed a technical implementation project or program; and/or prior experience in governance, risk management and compliance. Strong communication and interpersonal skills that can create a consensus on action from a wide spectrum of external and internal stakeholders; including multi-agency and inter-departmental teams Resourceful and proactive, particularly in proposing alternate solutions to achieve desired outcomes Attention to detail Analytical and creative Excellent written communication skills Having the following will be advantageous: Background in Computer Science/Engineering, Cybersecurity, Information Security, Data Science/Engineering or related fields Good knowledge of information security. Information Security certification such as CISSP, CISM, CISA Background in applications development, especially information security solutions Background in data science and data platforms Experience in privacy protection technology Experience in organisation development

Hiring_Company: Smart Nation and Digital Government Office
Job_Title: Senior Manager/Manager (Data Architecture), Government Data Office
Job_Descriptions: What the role is We want a change maker like you who is creative, collaborative and looks for challenges. You must be ready to roll up your sleeves and rally different teams across multiple agencies to meet our common mission: to speed up and ensure the adoption of data-driven decision-making within the public sector, and to realise the Government Data Strategy’s target of sharing core data within seven days by 2023. As part of the Data Architecture team, your objective will be to work with key data agencies to build up and operationalise the Government Data Architecture. You will define standards and processes to manage the quality of Government data, improve the efficiency and effectiveness of data sharing. You will help ensure that the Government Data Architecture is fit-for-purpose, secure, and scalable, as it serves not only one agency but the whole of Government. This role has significant impact as it enables Government agencies to better use data for policy analysis, service delivery and operations. The role does not involve technical implementation, but technical knowledge of data architecture is needed to shape the overall approach for the Government Data Architecture. For example, to recommend the architecture design that can enable data sharing for service delivery and operations use cases (e.g. use of APIs). What you will be working on This position reports to Deputy Director (Data Architecture). Together with the rest of the team, you will: a) Work with key domain agencies to operationalise the Government Data Strategy, including ingest, store, maintain, and share data across the WOG. b) Develop and maintain core standards and processes for managing data quality across government. c) Define and maintain a model and taxonomy to categorise and organise government data. d) Develop and maintain processes for sharing data within government. e) Support agencies in transforming their data architecture, use cases, and systems to provide more efficient and effective data sharing. What we are looking for We are looking for dynamic and self-motivated individuals who value integrity, teamwork and excellence. You will be a leader in this exciting field, and need to be able to contribute both at the individual level and provide guidance to your team members. If you share our passion in shaping Singapore into a Smart Nation, we welcome you to join us! Candidates should have: At least 3-5 years of working experience Background in Solution Architecture/Data Architecture, Data Engineering, Information/Computer Science, Data Analytics/Statistics or related fields Candidates should have experience in at least two of the following: Experience in setting standards in data management and infrastructure Participated in defining or maintaining an enterprise data architecture Participated in or overseen a data quality management process Experience in defining and conducting software quality assurance Produced business requirements or analytics as a consultant or business analyst Managed a technical implementation project or program Being competent in the following areas is advantageous: Background in data or solutions architecture Background in applications development Background in database management and administration Experience in managing privacy protection, including through technological solutions Experience in consulting on or implementing cybersecurity solutions Candidates must possess the following skills: Strong communication and interpersonal skills that can create a consensus on action from a wide spectrum of external and internal stakeholders; including multi-agency and inter-departmental teams Resourceful and proactive, particularly in proposing alternate solutions to achieve desired outcomes Analytical and creative Excellent written communication skills Only shortlisted applicants will be notified within 2 weeks after closing date. Successful candidates will be offered a 2-year contract in the first instance.

Hiring_Company: Smart Nation and Digital Government Office
Job_Title: Manager/Senior Manager (Data Policy), Government Data Office
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Government Data Office (GDO) is at the centre of driving data transformation within the public sector. This involves (a) developing whole-of-Government policies to promote data management, sharing and use; (b) identifying and driving new initiatives to improve the exchange of Government data with Government and non-Government partners; and (c) supporting Government agencies in their transformation to adopt new data science and AI technologies. As an Assistant Director / Senior Manager / Manager with the Data Policy team, you will be part of a dynamic and responsive team working towards ensuring the Singapore Government is better able to extract the full value of data in a robust and secured manner. This involves developing, refining and operationalising data management and governance policies and initiatives to encourage the pervasive and responsible use of data across the Whole-of-Government. We are looking for a change maker like you to make an out-sized impact to Singapore and Singaporeans. This position reports to Deputy Director (Data Policy). What you will be working on Specific Job Responsibilities: Conceptualise and develop personal data protection policies to safeguard the confidentiality of personal data, while enabling the Government to use it to serve the public effectively. Collaborate with Government agencies to operationalise and implement whole-of-Government personal data protection frameworks and guidelines. Provide consultation services to key stakeholders (e.g. senior leaders and Chief Data Officers) on personal data protection issues, including specific data-related Government products and projects. Engage the wider public service on the Government’s personal data protection and data management policies and initiatives. What we are looking for We are looking for dynamic and self-motivated individuals who value integrity, teamwork and excellence. If you share our passion in shaping Singapore into a Smart Nation, we welcome you to join us! Experience in the following areas is desired but not necessary: Experience in conceptualising and/or implementing data-related initiatives, such as in the areas of personal data protection, data governance or privacy compliance (e.g. Certified Information Privacy Professional or similar certifications are an advantage). Experience in conceptualising and/or implementing public policies. Background in Data Science, Data Analytics, Computer Science or other related fields. Candidates with the following personal traits are desired: Analytical and creative. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong interpersonal skills that can create a consensus on action from a wide spectrum of external and internal stakeholders, including multi-agency and inter-departmental teams. Resourceful and proactive, particularly in proposing alternate solutions to achieve desired outcomes.
